To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern

  • Quantitative modelling of business processes
  • Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
  • Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
  • Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive

What You Need To Know

  • Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
  • Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
  • Fluent English

We Are Looking For Someone Who

  • is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
  • can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
  • proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nippon Gases √® una delle aziende leader nel settore dei gas industriali e medicali in Europa. Con oltre 150.000 clienti e 350.000 pazienti in 13 Paesi, offriamo una gamma completa di soluzioni basate sui gas per i settori della sanit√†, dell'alimentazione, dell'elettronica, della produzione, dei prodotti chimici, dell'elettronica e dell'energia.
Entrate a far parte di un team che va oltre l'apparenza e ha un impatto positivo sul mondo. Preparatevi a pensare in modo innovativo, a far progredire la vostra carriera e a far crescere il vostro potenziale, contribuendo a costruire un futuro migliore.
In Nippon Gases abbiamo tutti lo stesso obiettivo: "Migliorare la vita grazie alla tecnologia dei gas".

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Data Analyst da inserire nel team Productivity , il cui obiettivo √® quello di identificare e sviluppare opportunit√† di innovazione allo scopo di migliorare i processi interni aziendali, sviluppare nuovi prodotti e servizi, supportare nuovi modelli di customer experience, proporre nuove metodologie di sviluppo e approccio ai progetti.

Responsabilit√†:
Come Data Analyst sarai coinvolto/a nell'analisi dei dati aziendali con le seguenti finalit√†:

Supportare il team nell'identificare le inefficienze dei processi aziendali
Sviluppare dashboard in Tableau/Power BI per il monitoraggio dei KPI dei processi aziendali
Sviluppare dashboard in Tableau/Power BI per il monitoraggio dei KPI dei progetti di Open Innovation al fine di determinarne l'impatto sull'azienda e l'adozione da parte degli utenti
Rispondere a quesiti aziendali specifici


Esperienze e competenze ricercate:
Per questo ruolo cerchiamo una persona con minima esperienza che abbia un'ottima dimestichezza con l'analisi dati e voglia di imparare. Vista la natura dei processi del gruppo, per avere successo in questa posizione, √® indispensabile avere affinit√† con problematiche dell'industria manifatturiera, quali supply chain, produzione, manutenzione, etc. Le analisi dati includeranno tuttavia anche dati provenienti dalle vendite e dal finance.
Nello specifico:

Laurea magistrale/specialistica in materie STEM
Esperienza massima di 2 anni in posizioni similari, possibilmente in realt√† industriali
Ottime competenze di statistica
Esperienza con SQL
Esperienza con Excel (da utilizzare solo in casi eccezionali)
Esperienza anche minima di R o Pyton
Lingua inglese (almeno livello B2)

Plus:

Esperienza con Tableau
Esperienza avanzata di Python o R
Esperienza con Power BI


Perch√© scegliere di entrare a far parte di Nippon Gases?
Nippon Gases √® un partner affidabile per industrie chiave, combinando l'esperienza internazionale con un approccio locale per fare davvero la differenza. Guidati dal nostro impegno per la sostenibilit√†, promuoviamo l'innovazione attraverso tecnologie all'avanguardia e una solida rete di ricerca e sviluppo. In Nippon Gases avrai l'autonomia di gestire la tua carriera, con l'opportunit√† di lavorare su progetti che influenzano le comunit√† e contribuiscono a plasmare un futuro con zero emissioni.

Scopri un luogo in cui potrai svolgere un ruolo chiave nello sviluppo di soluzioni che alimentano le principali industrie e fanno la differenza nella vita quotidiana. In Nippon Gases, le nostre tecnologie supportano innumerevoli processi essenziali - spesso dietro le quinte - che mantengono freschi gli alimenti, migliorano la produzione di chip elettronici, purificano l'acqua e forniscono trattamenti respiratori fondamentali. Con una solida e diversificata presenza in Europa, siamo un'azienda stabile e affidabile dedita all'innovazione costante e alla creazione di un futuro pi√π salutare e sostenibile.

Far parte dei Professionisti del Gas ti permetter√† di:

üåç Pensare oltre il visibile per esplorare e sviluppare nuove soluzioni per un domani sostenibile
üöÄ Muoverti e metterti alla prova con il supporto di un team collaborativo e di leader motivanti
üå± Crescere e amplificare il tuo talento fino al massimo potenziale, arrivando ovunque tu voglia


Cosa offriamo:

Retribuzione e Benefitüí∞: Offriamo bonus e piani welfare. Inoltre, disponiamo di vari benefit come il piano pensionistico e l'assicurazione sanitaria
Politica di lavoro da casa üíª: Con il nostro piano di lavoro ibrido, potrai godere della comodit√† di lavorare da casa per un massimo di 6 giorni al mese
Diversit√† e inclusione üòä: Entra a far parte di una cultura inclusiva e diversificata, dove il contributo di ciascuno √® valorizzato. Un ambiente dove il talento individuale √® riconosciuto e coltivato
Sostenibilit√† üçÄ: Ci impegniamo per un mondo a zero emissioni. Nippon Gases √® in prima linea nel guidare la transizione delle industrie dai combustibili fossili alle fonti di energia rinnovabile
La sicurezza prima di tutto ü¶∫: Creiamo un ambiente sicuro dove i nostri dipendenti possano prosperare. Negli ultimi vent'anni, siamo stati premiati 17 volte come l'azienda pi√π sicura d'Europa dalla Industrial Gases Association (EIGA)

Title: Data & Research trainee
Description:
About SAMY

SAMY is a leading global social first agency. We activate end-to-end media strategies, connecting with audiences in the most integrated and effective ways to solve key business challenges and make brands matter.



We are the first international ecosystem fueled by creativity, technology and culture, and by a team of 900+ people across 20 offices and 55 markets, serving more than 270 leading clients, including Europe, the U.S. and Latin America, who live and breathe social-first. Together, we create relevancy in the social universe for blue-chip brands such as L‚ÄôOr√©al, The North Face, Diageo, Microsoft and Samsung, among others.



Our vision is to lead the evolution of brand communication. At our core, we are Bold, Human and Transformative. We are adventurous. SAMY is where your career pushes boundaries and unlocks your highest potential. We were born with a desire to go further. To defy the status quo. To reshape our world.



This is your opportunity to work around the globe. With exciting clients. In projects that shape the industry.



Mission


We are seeking a Data & Insights Insights Trainee to join our dynamic team in Milan. This role is critical in leveraging data to drive actionable insights, shaping innovative strategies, and optimizing campaign performance. The ideal candidate is proactive, eager to learn, analytical, curious, and skilled at uncovering trends that guide creative and strategic decision-making. Please note that for this traineeship you need to be enrolled at an Italian university.



Key Responsibilities:

Provide regular reports on market and media data, delivering insights for both clients and the agency.


Monitor social media using relevant social listening tools


Conduct secondary research to provide broader context and deeper insights for clients and the agency.


Present findings to internal teams and clients.


Support the development of dashboards and databases to monitor and analyze client KPIs.


Provide technological support for clients.





Requirements


Academic Background: Market Research, Consumer Behavior, Social Media Analytics, Psychology, Quantitative Studies, or Similar studies.

Strong inclination to interpret data, visualize insights, and prepare reports.

Basic understanding of and interest in social listening tools like Sprinklr and Google Studio

Solid problem-solving and analytical skills.

Excellent communication and presentation skills (oral and written).

Quick learner with the ability to adapt to new tools and methodologies.

Proactive mindset with a willingness to master new insight tools and technologies.

Strong collaborative approach.

Genuine interest in research, data, human behavior and social media

High attention to detail in data analysis and report preparation.

C2 level in Italian and fluent in English is a must

Knowledge of SQL, or Python is a plus.

Social listening tools are a plus, specially Sprinklr

For this traineeship you need to be enrolled at an Italian university




Benefits


Hybrid work modality, 3 days in the office

Days off to be agreed with the manager

Dec 24 & 31 and your birthday off

Title: Data Analyst Marketing & Growth - Italy (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION


Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we‚Äôll give you what you need to make it happen. It won‚Äôt always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you‚Äôll never run alone. Run what runs the world.

This Position reports to:

Sales & Operations Pricing Manager


Your Role And Responsibilities

You will play a critical role in transforming data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization. This role combines analytical expertise with business acumen to guide marketing, sales, and financial planning through data-driven recommendations.


Work model:


In this role, you‚Äôll help run what runs the world by taking on meaningful work that drives real impact, as you will be accountable for:


Market analysis ‚Äì Preparing analyses of internal sales, technical and financial data, as well as external market data. Interpreting the resulting data and making recommendations to marketing and sales management. Building sales analyses regarding channels, segments, geographic areas, customers, products, systems, and services.
Business analysis ‚Äì Performing analyses of business performance versus budget and forecast, and proposing improvement actions. Benchmarking key performance indicators with external and internal peers.
Financial reporting ‚Äì Supporting the preparation of relevant organizational financial reporting, business planning, budgeting, and forecasting. Validating the accuracy of financial data and business information by performing reconciliations and reviewing exceptions.
Information and communication ‚Äì Providing information to management by assembling and summarizing data, preparing reports, and making presentations of findings, analyses, and recommendations.



Qualifications For The Role


Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerBI - DAX and Power Query. R and Phyton are a plus
You are passionate about data management and structures. Knowledge of costs and profitability KPIs is preferred
You enjoy working in a team and you have a good interpersonal attitude
You are goal-oriented, precise in following procedures and have a problem solving attitude
You are at ease communicating in both Italian and English languages



Benefits

Locally, you can count on:


Competitive compensation: Attractive salary packages and performance bonuses.
Corporate welfare: Access to a wide range of services and personal well-being support.
Career development: Structured career paths, individual development plans, opportunities for internal mobility, including international roles, technical and managerial training programs, mentoring and access to global learning platforms
Flexibility and work-life balance: Flexible working hours, hybrid work options, and a strong focus on work-life integration.
Employee Support: free services like psychological help, wellness coaching, and emotional support for employees and their families.
Parental Leave: at least 12 weeks of fully paid leave for primary caregivers and 4 weeks for secondary caregivers, promoting DEI values.
Meal allowance: Access to canteen or ticket restaurant is provided to support daily lunch expenses.



More About Us
ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts), helps manage the connection, protection and distribution of electrical power from source to socket. The Division‚Äôs products are engineered to provide ease of installation and perform in demanding and harsh conditions, helping to ensure safety and continuous operation for utilities, businesses and people around the world. The Commercial Essentials product segment includes electrical junction boxes, commercial fittings, strut and cable tray metal framing systems for commercial and residential construction. The Premier Industrial product segment includes multiple product lines, such as Ty-Rap¬Æ cable ties, T&B Liquidtight Systems¬Æ protection products, PVC coated and nylon conduit systems, power connection and grounding systems, and cable protection systems of conduits and fittings for harsh and industrial applications. The Division also manufactures solutions for medium-voltage applications used in the utility market under its marquee brands including Elastimold‚Ñ¢ reclosers and switchgear, capacitor switches, current limiting fuses, Homac‚Ñ¢ distribution connectors, Hi-Tech Valiant‚Ñ¢ full-range current limiting fuse for fire mitigation, faulted current indicators and distribution connectors, cable accessories and apparatus with products for overhead and underground distribution. Manufacturing includes made-to-stock and custom-made solutions.

Join us. Be part of the team where progress happens, industries transform, and your work shapes the world.

Run What Runs the World.

#ABBCareers #RunwithABB

We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

HTML:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we‚Äôll give you what you need to make it happen. It won‚Äôt always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you‚Äôll never run alone. Run what runs the world.

This Position reports to:

Sales & Operations Pricing Manager


Your Role And Responsibilities

You will play a critical role in transforming data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization. This role combines analytical expertise with business acumen to guide marketing, sales, and financial planning through data-driven recommendations.

  • Work model:

In this role, you‚Äôll help run what runs the world by taking on meaningful work that drives real impact, as you will be accountable for:

  • Market analysis ‚Äì Preparing analyses of internal sales, technical and financial data, as well as external market data. Interpreting the resulting data and making recommendations to marketing and sales management. Building sales analyses regarding channels, segments, geographic areas, customers, products, systems, and services.
  • Business analysis ‚Äì Performing analyses of business performance versus budget and forecast, and proposing improvement actions. Benchmarking key performance indicators with external and internal peers.
  • Financial reporting ‚Äì Supporting the preparation of relevant organizational financial reporting, business planning, budgeting, and forecasting. Validating the accuracy of financial data and business information by performing reconciliations and reviewing exceptions.
  • Information and communication ‚Äì Providing information to management by assembling and summarizing data, preparing reports, and making presentations of findings, analyses, and recommendations.


Qualifications For The Role

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerBI - DAX and Power Query. R and Phyton are a plus
  • You are passionate about data management and structures. Knowledge of costs and profitability KPIs is preferred
  • You enjoy working in a team and you have a good interpersonal attitude
  • You are goal-oriented, precise in following procedures and have a problem solving attitude
  • You are at ease communicating in both Italian and English languages


Benefits

Locally, you can count on:

  • Competitive compensation: Attractive salary packages and performance bonuses.
  • Corporate welfare: Access to a wide range of services and personal well-being support.
  • Career development: Structured career paths, individual development plans, opportunities for internal mobility, including international roles, technical and managerial training programs, mentoring and access to global learning platforms
  • Flexibility and work-life balance: Flexible working hours, hybrid work options, and a strong focus on work-life integration.
  • Employee Support: free services like psychological help, wellness coaching, and emotional support for employees and their families.
  • Parental Leave: at least 12 weeks of fully paid leave for primary caregivers and 4 weeks for secondary caregivers, promoting DEI values.
  • Meal allowance: Access to canteen or ticket restaurant is provided to support daily lunch expenses.


More About Us
ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts), helps manage the connection, protection and distribution of electrical power from source to socket. Manufacturing includes made-to-stock and custom-made solutions.

Title: Junior Digital Analyst
Description:
Chaberton Professionals, divisione di Chaberton Partners dedicata alla ricerca e selezione di profili di Middle Management, √® attualmente alla ricerca di un/una Junior Digital Analyst per un nostro importante cliente, publisher internazionale leader nel mondo dell'editoria e dell'intrattenimento.




Descrizione del lavoro:

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Digital Analyst motivato/a da inserire nel nostro team Data & Strategy, che si occupa della strategia digitale del gruppo, lavorando con le redazioni, la gestione degli abbonamenti, del CRM e di una parte di attivit√† consumer.




Questa figura si dovr√† occupare delle audience digitali del gruppo, utilizzando tool di analisi avanzati per fornire insight strategici al team editoriale e all'azienda. Il ruolo prevede un lavoro di analisi continuo sui trend di traffico del gruppo, rispondendo alle esigenze sia dei team editoriali che aziendali, all'interno della pi√π ampia strategia digitale, andando ad affiancare un‚Äôaltra risorsa.

Sar√† cruciale la collaborazione con i team internazionali, con i quali si lavora stabilmente per implementare nuove funzionalit√† e miglioramenti, oltre che con altre realt√† esterne per la gestione di progetti locali.




Responsabilit√†:

- Monitorare le performance dei nostri siti web utilizzando strumenti come Google Analytics, Marfeel e Looker.

- Fornire insight e raccomandazioni basate sui dati per ottimizzare la strategia digitale.

- Analizzare i trend di traffico per rispondere alle esigenze dei team editoriali e aziendali e costruzione di forecast.

- Collaborare con il team tech e prodotto internazionale per migliorare la salute tecnica e SEO dei siti.

- Gestire e aggiornare la reportistica, sviluppando nuove analisi per supportare le redazioni e il marketing.

- Coordinarsi con i team internazionali per implementare nuove funzionalit√† e miglioramenti.

- Seguire lo sviluppo di nuovi eventuali progetti digitali seguendone le fasi di implementazioni con i relativi team operativi.




Requisiti minimi:

- 2 anni di esperienza in ruoli simili.

- Esperienza di 2 anni nell'uso di sistemi di analisi delle audience come Google Analytics o similari.

- Capacit√† di interpretare le richieste degli sviluppatori.

- Competenze SEO e conoscenza delle best practice tecniche per i siti web.

- Capacit√† di interpretare e comunicare dati complessi in modo chiaro e conciso.

- Esperienza nella collaborazione con team tecnici e internazionali.

- Competenze analitiche eccezionali e capacit√† di problem solving.

- Familiarit√† con Looker, Looker Studio, GSheet.




Qualifiche preferite:

- Esperienza nel settore editoriale o dell'intrattenimento.

- Esperienza con BigQuery.

- Eccellenti capacit√† comunicative e attitudine al lavoro di squadra.




Sede di lavoro: Milano

Modalit√† di lavoro: ibrida

Title: MPIM Analytics Intern
Description:
Job Description

Calling all originals: At Levi Strauss & Co., you can be yourself ‚Äî and be part of something bigger. We‚Äôre a company of people who like to forge our own path and leave the world better than we found it. Who believe that what makes us different makes us stronger. So add your voice. Make an impact. Find your fit ‚Äî and your future.

About The Job

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Italy for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

Are you excited to learn more about Supply Chain and the Fashion industry? About using your analytic and problem-solving skills to tackle real life data problems? Do you want to be part of a young and dynamic team, while working for one of one of the most iconic global apparel brands? If so, do not hesitate to apply!

Key Responsabilities


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe‚Äôs business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of ad-hoc analysis requests and to feed predictive modelling.
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You speak fluently English (any other EU language is a plus)
You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics/Economics and Business Management
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months, renewable.

This is a hybrid position based in our Milano office. You will be expected in office minimum 3 days per week. Time in office can vary depending on business needs.

LS&Co. is an affirmative action and equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and value people from diverse cultures, backgrounds, and experiences to make LS&Co. a collective success.

LOCATION

Milan, Italy

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Stage ‚Äì Business Intelligence CRM
HTML:
Per il nostro team CRM cerchiamo una risorsa da inserire in stage con il ruolo di Business Intelligence CRM


Attivit√† previste

Durante il periodo di stage, la risorsa selezionata affiancher√† il team CRM nelle attivit√† di analisi e reportistica, contribuendo in particolare a:

  • Supportare l‚Äôelaborazione e l‚Äôinterpretazione dei dati provenienti dal sistema CRM, al fine di approfondire la conoscenza del comportamento dei clienti;
  • Analizzare le performance delle iniziative di marketing e fidelizzazione (DEM, attivit√† nei punti vendita, programma loyalty);
  • Collaborare all‚Äôindividuazione di trend di consumo, integrando dati interni e insight di mercato.


Profilo ideale

Il profilo che ricerchiamo presenta le seguenti caratteristiche:

  • Iscrizione a un corso di laurea in discipline statistiche, economiche o affini;
  • Spiccata attitudine analitica e forte interesse per l‚Äôanalisi dei dati;
  • Interesse per l‚Äôanalisi del Cliente tramite l‚Äôuso dei dati;
  • Precisione, curiosit√† e orientamento all‚Äôapprendimento di strumenti e metodologie di business intelligence, data visualization e analisi predittiva.


Competenze tecniche (preferenziali ma non vincolanti)

Nel corso dello stage sar√† possibile approfondire o sviluppare competenze nei seguenti ambiti:

  • Conoscenze di base di SQL e di linguaggi di programmazione statistica (es. Python, R, SAS);
  • Interesse per strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati (es. Tableau CRM / Salesforce Einstein Analytics);
  • Familiarit√† con strumenti di web analytics (es. Google Analytics);
  • Conoscenza di base o interesse per tecniche di segmentazione e clustering.

Title: Data & Process Developer
Description:
Tavola S.p.A. √® una solida realt√† italiana che fa bene ci√≤ in cui crede: migliorare la vita di tutti i giorni delle persone, con innovazioni sostenibili.

I nostri prodotti sono frutto delle nostre idee, della nostra cura, dei nostri valori e della nostra visione. Operiamo nel mercato del largo consumo con marchi leader nel settore personal care, household e automotive.

All‚Äôinterno del Reparto IT, siamo alla ricerca di una figura IT con forte orientamento alla gestione del dato e alla comprensione dei processi aziendali, capace di progettare e realizzare soluzioni di Business Intelligence a supporto delle funzioni operative.




La risorsa si occuper√† principalmente di:




Comprendere e mappare i processi aziendali (operations, supply chain, vendite, ecc.)
Reperire e trasformare i dati da fonti eterogenee (ERP, database, API, file)
Sviluppare e mantenere dashboard e report con Board (strumento principale), e supportare l‚Äôutilizzo di Power BI
Garantire coerenza e qualit√† del dato lungo tutto il processo informativo
Collaborare con gli utenti interni per tradurre i requisiti in soluzioni operative




Competenze richieste:




Conoscenza di Board o strumenti simili di BI (Qlik, Power BI, Tableau, Analysis Services)
Eccellente padronanza di SQL e dei principali database relazionali
Capacit√† di modellare e interpretare i processi aziendali
Conoscenza dei processi ERP, preferibilmente Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
Familiarit√† con architettura dati e pipeline informativa




Costituiscono un plus:




Conoscenza dei seguenti linguaggi e tecnologie: .NET, Power Apps, JavaScript, CSS, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
Esperienza con pipeline ETL, in particolare SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) o tecnologie equivalenti
Esperienza in Power Query per trasformazione dati Microsoft Tech Community+15Wikipedia+15Microsoft Learn+15
Familiarit√† con nuovi strumenti Microsoft per l'integrazione ETL e gestione dati:
Microsoft Fabric (pipelines ETL/ELT, Data Factory integrato, lakehouse, Dataflows Gen2) Stridely Solutions+3Microsoft Tech Community+3Microsoft Fabric Community+3
Microsoft Dataverse collegato a Fabric tramite ‚ÄúLink to Fabric‚Äù/Synapse Link, per integrazione in real‚Äëtime senza duplicazione dati Microsoft Learn+8Microsoft+8Microsoft Learn+8
OneLake come data lake unificato e supporto a pipeline T‚ÄëSQL e Spark notebooks dynatechconsultancy.com+15Microsoft Learn+15Agora Tech+15
Esperienza in data analysis o data engineering




Offriamo un contratto a tempo indeterminato, in un ambiente collaborativo, orientato all‚Äôinnovazione e al miglioramento continuo.




Luogo di lavoro: Milano Sud.




Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le et√† e tutte le nazionalit√†, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03. Le persone interessate, sono invitate a trasmettere un analitico curriculum vitae con foto corredato da espressa autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali conferiti.

Title: Stage Consumer & Customer Insights Analyst
Description:
To support the development and realization of the Strategic Landscape and the Strategy & Insight Frameworks through leading strategic
and insight development initiatives across Ingka Group.

Based on defined business needs create and share actionable consumer and customer insights to enable better informed strategies, plans and decisions in the local market. Build consumer and customer understanding to inform key stakeholders within and outside commercial how to create value for customers and consumers, while delivering growth for the business.

You will:

-Collect, analyse and synthetize consumer, customer, brand, and internal data to generate insights that contribute to recommendations and informed decisions making

-Manage, develop and improve marketing intelligence activities including market research, competitive environment, key market players behaviours, market and macroeconomics trends, demand and consumption development

-Support the Insights Leader in adaptation, implementation and work with global tools, methodologies and solutions, and contribute to creation of new where necessary

-Act as a member of the C&CI team and proactively contribute insight & ideas to C&CI plan/output in order to deliver to the common objectives and goals







You will be inserted in the Consumer & Insight team at the IKEA Retail Italia headquarters in Carugate. You will find a dynamic, international and challenging environment. During your internship you will have the opportunity to support the team in different activities:

-Academic background in Marketing, Innovation, Business Administration or related field
-Strong analytical skills with the ability to convert data to commercially viable insights
-Interest for a dynamic environment under transformation such as Retail
-Good leadership capabilities with the ability to communicate in an inspirational way
-Experience in using quantitative and qualitative research and internal data
-Advanced use of MS Office, in particular Excel and Power Point
-Fluent in English

Apply Now!

‚Ä¢ Duration 6 months - 40/h weekly
‚Ä¢ Reimbursement of expenses 850‚Ç¨ monthly
‚Ä¢ Free company canteen







There‚Äôs a big difference between doing things right and doing the right things. In our team we gather insights from big data to make sure IKEA does the right things. We‚Äôre a diverse group of people who spend our days digging into consumer behaviour and how people live their lives at home. You could say that we know the trends before they‚Äôre actually trends ‚Äì and we use that knowledge to create a better everyday life for our customers.










WE CARE FOR PEOPLE

At IKEA we cultivate an inclusive work environment where everyone feels welcomed, accepted, respected, acknowledged for its uniqueness and where we work together in a supportive climate regardless age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, pregnancy and ability.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Italian.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!




Work From Home - WFH - Remote - Freelance - Telecommuting - Flexible

Title: Analista di processo
Description:
Chi stiamo cercando?

Per la Digital Factory E-Health & Smart City stiamo ricercando la figura di analista di processo.

La figura selezionata seguir√† le attivit√† di clienti in ambito sanitario, con funzione SPOC tra i vari stakeholders.

Guidare i clienti nelle attivit√† di aggiornamento IT;
Assistere gli enti nelle comunicazioni interne ed esterne;
Fornire report e statistiche.




Requisiti:

Laurea Specialistica o Magistrale in ingegneria biomedica o informatica
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in progetti interni agli Enti Sanitari (CUP o Sistema Contabile/Amministrativo o Cartella Clinica Elettronica).
Capacit√† di Stesura documentazione di progetto: scenari di integrazione, checklist di validazione
Capacit√† di gestione della comunicazione e delle relazioni con Software House fornitrici e strutture aziendali di demand management
Conoscenza linguaggio xml
Conoscenze di Excel e SQL
Predisposizione e interesse per attivit√† di gestione risorse e progetti







Completano il profilo ottime capacit√† di comunicazione, teamwork, flessibilit√†, problem solving.

Chi siamo:

Il Gruppo Exprivia, specializzato in Information and Communication Technology (ICT), √® tra i principali protagonisti della trasformazione digitale sul mercato nazionale e internazionale con un team di esperti (oltre 2400 professionisti) in diversi ambiti della tecnologia e della digitalizzazione: dall‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale alla Cybersecurity, dai Big Data, al Cloud, dall'IoT al BPO, dal Mobile al Networking e alla Collaboration, presidiando interamente il mondo SAP.




Exprivia supporta i propri clienti nei settori Banking, Finance&Insurance, Aerospace&Defence, Energy&Utilities, Healthcare e Public Sector, Manufacturing&Distribution, Telco&Media.







Il Gruppo Exprivia √® presente in sei Paesi nel mondo (Italia, Spagna, Germania, Brasile, Messico e Cina) e presente in Italia a Milano, Roma, Trento, Vicenza, Lecce, Matera, Palermo e Molfetta dove √® basato l‚ÄôHQ.

Rispondendo al presente annuncio/email, la societ√† Exprivia S.p.a., nella sua qualit√† di Titolare del Trattamento, otterr√† i Suoi dati, definiti dal GDPR (regolamento UE 2016/679) "dati personali", esclusivamente per finalit√† relative alla ricerca e selezione del personale alle posizioni aperte attuali e future, per un potenziale inserimento all‚Äôinterno delle singole societ√† del Gruppo societario.

I Suoi dati personali potranno essere comunicati anche alle altre societ√† del Gruppo che ne facciano richiesta per valutare un‚Äôeventuale assunzione in presenza di un interesse legittimo. Lei potr√† esercitare i suoi diritti privacy, compreso il diritto di opporsi alla comunicazione infragruppo, rivolgendosi al titolare o al DPO alle mail ufficio.privacy@exprivia.com o dpo_expriviaspa@exprivia.com.

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant - Milan
Description:
About the Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to; the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources; the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model; the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

Responsibilities

Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:

Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally; foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate
Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.


Our Ideal Candidate

Educated to degree level
Approximately 1 year of experience in web / marketing analytics (preferably as a business analyst/ data analyst/ marketing analyst, or with experience in paid media buying)
Native or bilingual english is mandatory
Familiarity with the Google stack
Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
A confident presenter
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
Interest in working in a small, growing team

If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.

In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:

Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
Phone allowance
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid
UnMind App subscription

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.

In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Per conto di una storica realt√† multinazionale operante nel settore Petrolifero cerchiamo, da inserire a diretto riporto del Coordinatore Continuous Improvement, un/una:




DATA ANALYST




La figura supporter√† il Coordinatore Continuous Improvement nell'analisi, ottimizzazione e automazione dei processi aziendali.

Operer√† attraverso la raccolta e elaborazione dei dati, sviluppo di soluzioni tecnologiche a supporto del miglioramento continuo e implementazione di nuove metodologie di analisi, con un focus specifico sull'utilizzo di strumenti di Business Intelligence, automazione e Intelligenza Artificiale.




Responsabilit√† & Attivit√†:

Raccogliere, pulire e analizzare dataset complessi, sviluppando dashboard e report interattivi con Power BI (o strumenti analoghi) per monitorare le performance dei processi e identificare aree di miglioramento
Individuare attivit√† ripetitive e sviluppare script in Python o soluzioni di automazione per ottimizzare l‚Äôoperativit√†
Collaborare con l‚Äôarea Planning per migliorare previsioni e schedulazioni tramite strumenti o modelli a supporto
Partecipare a progetti di Intelligenza Artificiale e Machine Learning per analisi predittive e ottimizzazione dei processi.
Supportare il Coordinatore nella mappatura e analisi dei processi aziendali, identificando inefficienze e opportunit√† di innovazione.
Essere aggiornato sulle nuove tecnologie e proporre soluzioni innovative.
Redigere e mantenere la documentazione tecnica e progettuale.
Redigere report per l‚ÄôHQ: report, dashboard e/o PPT.




Requisiti:

Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica o Gestionale (indirizzo IT/Data Science), Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Data Science o affini.
Costituir√† un plus la frequenza di Master o corsi di alta formazione in Data Analytics, AI, Machine Learning o Business Process Automation.
Esperienza di 1-3 anni (anche tramite stage avanzati o progetti universitari complessi) in ruoli di Data Analysis, Business Intelligence o automazione processi.
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik).
Competenze in Python per analisi dati, scripting e automazione.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.




Preferibile:

Familiarit√† con concetti di process automation (RPA) e process mining
Prime esperienze con algoritmi di Intelligenza Artificiale o Machine Learning per analisi predittive o ottimizzazione.




Completano il profilo: proattivit√†, autonomia, ottime capacit√† tecnologiche e analitiche, curiosit√†, creativit√† e orientamento al problem solving, buone doti comunicative e relazionali.




Sede di lavoro: Milano




Si offre: assunzione diretta con l‚Äô azienda Cliente con inquadramento e retribuzione commisurati all‚Äôesperienza + benefits.




L‚Äôinformativa Privacy √® consultabile sul sito www.studioassociato.it - Seguici anche su Linkedin Lovati&Associati

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Chi siamo: Dils

Dils √® un gruppo internazionale leader nel real estate presente in Italia, Olanda e Portogallo e Spagna, protagonista del processo di trasformazione dell‚Äôintero settore attraverso le leve dell‚Äôinnovazione e della digitalizzazione. Con un team di oltre 600 professionisti e uffici a Milano, Roma, Amsterdam, Lisbona, Porto, Algarve, Barcellona, Madrid e molte altre citt√† in Spagna, Dils √® il punto di riferimento per imprese nazionali e multinazionali, investitori, operatori finanziari e privati per la ricerca e lo sviluppo delle migliori opportunit√† in ambito immobiliare nei settori Uffici, Retail, Logistica, Hospitality, Living & Residenziale. Il Gruppo si avvale anche di un Transformation Team interno, specializzato in Technology, IT, Marketing & Digital, Graphic Design, 3D visual e Research, con l‚Äôobiettivo di massimizzare la spinta al cambiamento dell‚Äôazienda.




Forte di una storia di oltre 50 anni nel mercato italiano con Redilco e Sigest, nel 2021 l‚ÄôAzienda cambia nome e diventa Dils. Dopo l‚Äôingresso in Olanda con Van Gool Elburg nel 2023, in Portogallo con Castelhana nel 2024 e in Spagna con Lucas Fox nel 2025, il Gruppo prosegue nel progetto di espansione europea per esportare la vision e il modello distintivo di business anche in Francia, Germania, Polonia e UK. Dils esprime la propria volont√† di innovare anche attraverso un nuovo modello di business basato sulla responsabilit√† sociale con un programma pluriennale di give back finalizzato a valorizzare e promuovere il territorio e le diverse identit√† che lo abitano.




Stiamo cercando un/a Research Analyst da inserire nel nostro ufficio di Milano nel Team Research.




Attivit√† Principali

Monitoraggio trend e dati delle principali asset class (Office, Logistics, Retail, Living, Hospitality, Alternative)
Supporto alla pubblicazioni e report di mercato per clienti e stakeholder
Approfondita analisi dei dati multidisciplinari (es: macroeconomiche, socio-demografiche, urbanistiche)
Supporto ai team interni con approfondimenti, dashboard e soluzioni analitiche su misura
Collaborazione con il network internazionale Research di Dils su progetti multicountry
Partecipazione allo sviluppo di strumenti digitali e insight tool innovativi




Requisiti

Laurea in Economia, Ingegneria, Statistica o campi affini
Capacit√† di analisi quantitativa e visualizzazione dei dati
Esperienza con Excel, PowerPoint e strumenti di presentazione
Ottime doti di comunicazione sia scritta che parlata, in italiano e in inglese
Conoscenza di Power BI o strumenti di business intelligence (plus)
Conoscenze di prompting AI e tool digitali innovativi (plus)
L'esperienza precedente nel settore real estate √® considerata un plus




Cosa puoi aspettarti unendoti a noi

L‚Äôopportunit√† di affiancare i migliori talenti e perseguire una carriera stimolante
Un respiro internazionale e la possibilit√† di lavorare con colleghi di altre nazionalit√† e culture
Sede di Lavoro a Milano, Piazza Diaz n. 7. Al 13¬∞ piano, la nostra Dils House, uno spazio ibrido in cui ci si incontra per una colazione o un pranzo tra colleghi, un break informale, un momento di ricarica di fronte al magnifico panorama sulla citt√†
Un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e benefits




In Dils crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôinnovazione, guidata da tecnologia, dati ma soprattutto persone. Per questo vediamo la diversit√† in tutte le sue forme come una fonte di scambio e arricchimento e offriamo pari opportunit√† indipendentemente da etnia, colore, discendenza, religione, sesso, nazionalit√†, orientamento sessuale, et√†, cittadinanza, stato civile, disabilit√† o identit√† di genere.




Informativa Privacy

I vostri dati personali saranno trattati da Dils S.p.A, con sede in P.zza Armando Diaz, 7 ‚Äì 20123, Milano (MI), Italia. Ai sensi dell‚ÄôArticolo 24 del GDPR, i Contitolari definiscono congiuntamente le finalit√† ed i mezzi del trattamento dei dati personali. Per maggiori informazioni https://dils.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Business intelligence
Description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SPECIALIST




Job Description

The candidate will become the leading member of the Business Intelligence Team and will collaborate with the rest of the IT Team on projects for companies of the Elemaster group.

He/She will design, develop and maintain Business Intelligence solutions to support Business Processes; collaborating transversally with Finance, Operations, HR, Sales, Facilities and Project Management departments.

The desired methodology is ‚Äúdesign once, run everywhere‚Äù since Elemaster is a group of multinational companies.

The Candidate will also guide the Artificial Intelligence Projects Elemaster is implementing internally and partners; efforts aimed at improving daily productivity on key Business Processes.

He/She will become part of a young, multicultural and skilled team where we welcome new ideas and skillsets. We prefer quality over quantity and try to implement long-term solutions that help the business thrive.




Technical Skills

Extensive knowledge of SQL language and Tools; in particular SqlServer and Oracle
Proven experience with OLAP solutions; DAX language and SSAS are considered a plus
ETL tools and techniques
Experience with cloud and on-premise integration
Business Intelligence Tools; PowerBI and Board preferred




Responsibilities

Focus on data quality and standardization
Analyze, create and maintain reporting or business intelligence solutions to help understand and improve the work of other business functions:
Production Planning
Logistics
Sales and Customer Relationship Management
Human Resources
Environmental,Social and Governance
Accouting
Controlling
Implement and monitor application integrations and interfaces




Other desired skills

Financial skills (basic):
Consolidated financial statements
Economic and financial KPIs
Budgeting, forecasting, and ESG reporting processes
Ability to communicate with Finance and Sustainability functions to translate requirements into technical solutions
Advanced AI and analytics (plus)
Interest or knowledge of Artificial Intelligence applied to BI, for example:
Forecasting algorithms
Customer or supplier segmentation
Automated data analysis




Softskills

Strong focus on results and continuous improvement
Ability to work in cross-functional teams
Autonomous project management
Ability to communicate with business users and technicians




Direct supervisor

IT Manager

Title: Data Visualization & Business Intelligence Intern
Description:
Merkle, a dentsu tech agency, is a leading data-driven customer experience management (CXM) company that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices, such as one of the two leading Company in the last Forrester Wawe in CXM Area.




We are looking for a Data Visualization & BI Intern for our Milan office.




Key responsibilities:




As a member of the Data Visualization Team you will develop attractive and innovative dashboards interacting with external and internal clients to satisfy their needs
Discover and collect data from heterogeneous data sources, understanding their value and map them to the target/common data model
Identify & define key business metrics and KPIs in partnership with business stakeholders
Use different technologies to transform data sets, quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling user-centric dashboards that empower data driven insights & decision-making capabilities
Help final users with tools adoption and active listening to identify new business opportunities
Use problem solving and strategic thinking to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment




Qualifications:




Data-oriented personality and quantitative thinking
Basic experience and/or knowledge of Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Datorama), certification is a plus
Basic ability to use SQL and other Database (NO-SQL) to explore, analyze and validate heterogeneous data sources
Basic knowledge of data warehousing concepts (ETL, Stage/Core layer, Dimensional Modelling, Data Marts etc.) and SQL programming
Passionate for learning and willingness to adopt and share new ideas
Self-motivation, proactivity, and ability to work independently with problem-solving attitude
Fluent English, written and spoken;
Advanced Italian, written and spoken (minimum level C2)




What we offer:




6 months of internship
A dynamic and stimulating work environment with opportunities for professional growth.
Opportunities to work with high-profile clients and on innovative projects.
Continuous training and skill development.




Additional Information




We work with highly motivated people, who support and enrich each other. We live the possibilities of the digital world through home office, meaning you can work anywhere with flexible (annual) working hours. We also value face-to-face exchanges - coffee or tea, biscuits or fruit are all welcomed on board and shared throughout our offices.

If you ever feel the need to take a break from the digital world, we love to get hands on together and use pens, paper, and whiteboards for brainstorming sessions. Need to clear your head? Hit the foosball table, PlayStation, massage bench or yoga mat. For networking and (brain) food, we offer regular exchange formats, like meetings, tech labs and more. Not enough? We are full believers in education and support training, whether it be internally or externally. We support you.




If you feel inspired by us, we‚Äôll probably be inspired by you. Join us now and apply online to make sure we match each other‚Äôs expectations. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We welcome all qualified candidates - regardless of your gender or background, please indicate your salary expectations and possible entry date. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Junior Data Engineer - Data Products
Description:
Scopo e attivit√†




La figura ricercata, in qualit√† di DATA ENGINEER, dovr√† progettare e sviluppare i software applicativi e le relative componenti dati, massimizzandone la qualit√† e la performance nel rispetto delle specifiche tecniche e funzionali definite, a stretto contatto con il team progettuale e funzionale dell‚Äôambito applicativo di riferimento, supportandoli nella scelta delle migliori opzioni tecnologiche al fine di rendere efficienti e stabili gli ambiti applicativi.

Collaborer√† all‚Äôinterno del team di progetto con i responsabili che gestiscono gli aspetti progettuali e funzionali dell‚Äôambito, supportandoli nella scelta delle migliori opzioni tecnologiche e soluzioni architetturali al fine di rendere efficienti e stabili gli ambiti applicativi in oggetto. Parteciper√† alla fase di rilascio nel rispetto delle pianificazioni e qualit√† dei rilasci.

Lavorerai all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôarea Group Technology del Gruppo Intesa Sanpaolo, nel Domain Data.

Le principali attivit√†:

Conduzione o partecipazione alla gestione di progetti trasformativi basati sui dati
Progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni software innovative in modalit√† batch e near-real time, su ambienti tecnologici on premise e cloud
Mantenimento della coerenza tra quanto sviluppato e gli standard aziendali
Mantenimento della coerenza tra quanto sviluppato e la normativa aziendale con particolare riferimento alla Cybersecurity, alla Privacy, al Change Management e al Data Management
Coordinamento degli sviluppi delle varie progettualit√†
Esecuzione attivit√† di analisi tecnica
Definizione e controllo linee guida di sviluppo
Individuare le linee strategiche di evoluzione, progettare ed evolvere le applicazioni presenti all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôecosistema del Domain Data
Collaborazione con il Project Manager per la definizione dello Stato Avanzamento Lavori, identificazione e indirizzamento delle criticit√†, identificazione e gestione proattiva dei rischi di progetto
Analisi e valutazione dei rischi di progetto per individuare azioni a mitigazione degli stessi
Progettazione e realizzazione dei presidi di data governance e data quality in linea con le linee guida aziendali
Partecipazione alle fasi di progettazione, preparazione ed esecuzione dei test tecnici e funzionali
Partecipazione alle fasi di User Acceptance Test
Gestione della relazione con altri membri del team interno ed esterno di sviluppo




Esperienza Richiesta




Sono richiesti almeno 2-3 anni di esperienza in progetti IT in ambito dati, a media o alta complessit√†, preferibilmente nel contesto bancario, finanziario o settore creditizio.

Esperienza nella gestione delle dinamiche di gruppo tipiche di progetti di grandi dimensioni con diversi stakeholder e team di lavoro geograficamente distribuiti.




Esperienza,Competenze,Skill e Qualifiche richieste




Laurea Triennale o Magistrale in discipline STEM
Livello ‚Äòfluent‚Äô di conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata
Conoscenza delle architetture delle basi dati
Conoscenza dei modelli di integrazione nell‚Äôambito del sistema informativo
Conoscenza della progettazione di Datawarehouse
Conoscenza delle tecnologie di data transformation
Conoscenza delle tecnologie di data communication
Conoscenza dei principali db SQL
Conoscenza dei principali db NOSQL
Conoscenza di architetture a microservizi
Conoscenza dei sistemi di versionamento del software
Conoscenza del processo e degli strumenti di Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivey e Continuous Deployment del DevOps
Conoscenza DataOps
Conoscenza dei sistemi di workflow
Conoscenza Apache Hadoop
Conoscenza Teradata
Conoscenza Oracle
Conoscenza Google BigQuery
Conoscenza PostgreSQL
Conoscenza dei processi IT
Conoscenza dei processi di produzione del software
Conoscenza della metodologia di sviluppo Agile Scrum
Conoscenza delle metodologie di Data Quality
Conoscenza delle metodologie di Data Governance
Conoscenza degli ambienti cloud: Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure
Conoscenza dei principali sistemi operativi




Requisiti preferenziali (plus):




Conoscenza dei sistemi di sintesi in ambito bancario, finanziario o settore creditizio
Competenza in progetti IT con l‚Äôutilizzo dello strumento ALM Quality Center
Competenza in progetti IT in ambienti Google Cloud Platform
Competenza in progetti IT con l‚Äôutilizzo dello strumento di versionamento GIT e IBM Rational Team Concert
Competenza Java in ambito enterprise
Competenza in progetti IT con utilizzo dei framework: SAS, Python, R
Conoscenza Apache Spark
Conoscenza PySpark
Conoscenza algoritmi di AI
Conoscenza algoritmi di AIGen




Chi siamo




Siamo leader in Italia e uno dei principali gruppi bancari in Europa. Unisciti a noi e fai parte della nostra storia di successo! Con oltre 20 milioni di clienti in Italia e all'estero siamo un vero e proprio motore di crescita sostenibile con un forte impegno per l'ambiente e un impatto tangibile sulla societ√†.

Le persone sono al centro, ce ne prendiamo cura impegnandoci nel creare una cultura inclusiva all'interno del Gruppo in cui tutti si sentano protagonisti e valorizzati.




Unisciti alla nostra realt√† internazionale. Il futuro non si aspetta, si sceglie!

Parteciper√† alla fase di rilascio nel rispetto delle pianificazioni e qualit√† dei rilasci.

Lavorerai all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôarea Group Technology del Gruppo Intesa Sanpaolo, nel Domain Data.

Le principali attivit√†:

  • Conduzione o partecipazione alla gestione di progetti trasformativi basati sui dati
  • Progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni software innovative in modalit√† batch e near-real time, su ambienti tecnologici on premise e cloud
  • Mantenimento della coerenza tra quanto sviluppato e gli standard aziendali
  • Mantenimento della coerenza tra quanto sviluppato e la normativa aziendale con particolare riferimento alla Cybersecurity, alla Privacy, al Change Management e al Data Management
  • Coordinamento degli sviluppi delle varie progettualit√†
  • Esecuzione attivit√† di analisi tecnica
  • Definizione e controllo linee guida di sviluppo
  • Individuare le linee strategiche di evoluzione, progettare ed evolvere le applicazioni presenti all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôecosistema del Domain Data
  • Collaborazione con il Project Manager per la definizione dello Stato Avanzamento Lavori, identificazione e indirizzamento delle criticit√†, identificazione e gestione proattiva dei rischi di progetto
  • Analisi e valutazione dei rischi di progetto per individuare azioni a mitigazione degli stessi
  • Progettazione e realizzazione dei presidi di data governance e data quality in linea con le linee guida aziendali
  • Partecipazione alle fasi di progettazione, preparazione ed esecuzione dei test tecnici e funzionali
  • Partecipazione alle fasi di User Acceptance Test
  • Gestione della relazione con altri membri del team interno ed esterno di sviluppo


Esperienza Richiesta


Sono richiesti almeno 2-3 anni di esperienza in progetti IT in ambito dati, a media o alta complessit√†, preferibilmente nel contesto bancario, finanziario o settore creditizio.

Esperienza nella gestione delle dinamiche di gruppo tipiche di progetti di grandi dimensioni con diversi stakeholder e team di lavoro geograficamente distribuiti.


Esperienza,Competenze,Skill e Qualifiche richieste


  • Laurea Triennale o Magistrale in discipline STEM
  • Livello ‚Äòfluent‚Äô di conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata
  • Conoscenza delle architetture delle basi dati
  • Conoscenza dei modelli di integrazione nell‚Äôambito del sistema informativo
  • Conoscenza della progettazione di Datawarehouse
  • Conoscenza delle tecnologie di data transformation
  • Conoscenza delle tecnologie di data communication
  • Conoscenza dei principali db SQL
  • Conoscenza dei principali db NOSQL
  • Conoscenza di architetture a microservizi
  • Conoscenza dei sistemi di versionamento del software
  • Conoscenza del processo e degli strumenti di Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivey e Continuous Deployment del DevOps
  • Conoscenza DataOps
  • Conoscenza dei sistemi di workflow
  • Conoscenza Apache Hadoop
  • Conoscenza Teradata
  • Conoscenza Oracle
  • Conoscenza Google BigQuery
  • Conoscenza PostgreSQL
  • Conoscenza dei processi IT
  • Conoscenza dei processi di produzione del software
  • Conoscenza della metodologia di sviluppo Agile Scrum
  • Conoscenza delle metodologie di Data Quality
  • Conoscenza delle metodologie di Data Governance
  • Conoscenza degli ambienti cloud: Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure
  • Conoscenza dei principali sistemi operativi


Requisiti preferenziali (plus):


  • Conoscenza dei sistemi di sintesi in ambito bancario, finanziario o settore creditizio
  • Competenza in progetti IT con l‚Äôutilizzo dello strumento ALM Quality Center
  • Competenza in progetti IT in ambienti Google Cloud Platform
  • Competenza in progetti IT con l‚Äôutilizzo dello strumento di versionamento GIT e IBM Rational Team Concert
  • Competenza Java in ambito enterprise
  • Competenza in progetti IT con utilizzo dei framework: SAS, Python, R
  • Conoscenza Apache Spark
  • Conoscenza PySpark
  • Conoscenza algoritmi di AI
  • Conoscenza algoritmi di AIGen


Chi siamo


Siamo leader in Italia e uno dei principali gruppi bancari in Europa. Unisciti a noi e fai parte della nostra storia di successo! Con oltre 20 milioni di clienti in Italia e all'estero siamo un vero e proprio motore di crescita sostenibile con un forte impegno per l'ambiente e un impatto tangibile sulla societ√†.

Le persone sono al centro, ce ne prendiamo cura impegnandoci nel creare una cultura inclusiva all'interno del Gruppo in cui tutti si sentano protagonisti e valorizzati.


Unisciti alla nostra realt√† internazionale. Il futuro non si aspetta, si sceglie!

#sharingfuture

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Mollie, we‚Äôre on a mission to make payments and money management effortless for every business in Europe. We started 20 years ago when we launched a more direct, affordable way for companies to get paid. That provided an alternative to the frustrating, overpriced solutions that banks offered at the time.

Today, we serve more than 250,000 businesses across Europe with an all-in-one solution that simplifies payments and money management. And we‚Äôre a 850-strong team of product, finance, support, commerce, and engineering specialists working across Europe ‚Äì from Lisbon to London.

Your Opportunity

We're looking for an experienced and motivated Data Analyst to lead the analytical efforts of our Real-time Fraud Monitoring Team.

Working within one of Mollie's newest verticals, our team is dedicated to protecting our account holders from financial crimes. We're on the front lines, developing scalable, automated risk decision-making tools that operate in milliseconds. Here, real-time data meets real-world security.

This role isn't just about technical expertise; it's about addressing critical business challenges. You'll use your technical skills to design, build, and optimise intricate data pipelines and analytical solutions for fraud detection. You'll work with Mollie's complex, real-time data flows, transforming raw data into actionable insights that directly combat financial crime and enable swift risk decisions.

You'll play a key role in driving impactful solutions from concept to deployment, partnering closely with our engineering, product, and operations teams to ensure our analytical capabilities are seamlessly integrated. Your efforts will directly contribute to protecting our account holders, turning data into the shield that safeguards our business.

What You‚Äôll Do


Data product development: Build and maintain robust, performant, easy-to-use data products and dashboards to monitor key fraud metrics and help us make decisions
Data analysis & interpretation: Analyse merchant behaviour and transaction data to detect patterns, anomalies, and potential fraud indicators to inform Mollie's risk strategy.
Data visualisation & storytelling: Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to effectively communicate your findings to technical and non-technical audiences using various mediums, e.g. presentations, reports, memos, etc.
Documentation & knowledge sharing: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data products, processes, and analyses to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding of new team members.
Data quality assurance: Implement data quality checks and processes to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data used for analysis and decision-making.
Experimentation & prototyping: Develop and test new analytical approaches and models through experimentation and prototyping to improve fraud detection and risk assessment.


What You Bring


Proven experience in analytics within a complex risk, fintech, or payments environment
Strong technical foundation in SQL and Python; experience with data modelling and automation
Deep understanding of one or more risk areas: fraud, AML/CFT, credit risk
Experience leading analysts or analytics engineers, with a track record of raising the bar
Ability to zoom out and to zoom in to support implementation, often on the same day
Skilled at stakeholder management, especially across technical and non-technical teams
Business-aware, impact-driven, and curious

Raccolta ed elaborazione di dati economici e di mercato.
Organizzazione strutturata e dettagliata dei dati raccolti.
Analisi dei trend e delle possibili implicazioni politiche ed economiche a supporto delle attivit√† aziendali.
In una fase successiva, a seguito di formazione interna, possibilit√† di contribuire alla redazione di reportistica e presentazioni destinate ai clienti.

Disponibilit√† a rare trasferte in Italia ed all‚Äôestero.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Il Gruppo Lynx √® specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.200 risorse ed √® da anni partner di primarie realt√† internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The candidate will play a crucial role in managing and analyzing data for our Claims Department, providing support to the Performance Monitoring Unit and contributing to the full spectrum of claims processes. Your expertise in reporting will be essential in assisting the Business Managers in making informed decisions. We are looking for a talented and proactive individual with strong skills in collaboration. This person should be able to work closely with various Units within the Claims Department, as well as with other teams in our Company, our Group Headquarters, and other Allianz Operating Entities around the world

Key Responsibilities


Design and implement a management controlling system to monitor and track ordinary business and strategic project initiatives.
Monitor the results of initiatives and assess their impact on financial statements.
Collaborate with other Units within the Claims Department and global operating entities to deploy the initiatives of the Plan.
Update and revise priorities listed in the Plan based on observed results of initiatives.
Suggest additional initiatives to ensure the achievement of targets identified in the Plan.
Coordinate reporting preparation and updates at the Allianz Group level


Key Requirements/Skills/Experience


Master's degree in Economics, Business, Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in a consultancy environment (previous experience in Planning & Controlling, M&A, Data Analytics or equivalent will be considered a plus).
Proactive approach in collaborating with other business functions and Group Headquarters.
Excellent knowledge of:

SAS application platform, particularly SAS Base and SAS Macro programming languages and the Output Delivery System (ODS) module
Microsoft Office‚Ñ¢ tools and VBA programming language.
SQL language
Power BI and reporting platforms
Celonis software and process mining analysis
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.


75562 | Customer Services & Claims | Entry Level | [[custPositionClusterCSB]] | Allianz Italy | Full Time or Part Time | Permanent

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

At Allianz, we stand for unity: we believe that a united world is a more prosperous world, and we are dedicated to consistently advocating for equal opportunities for all. And the foundation for this is our inclusive workplace, where people and performance both matter, and nurtures a culture grounded in integrity, fairness, inclusion and trust.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).
