Title: Data & BI Analyst
HTML:
Descrizione del messaggio

Data & BI Analyst

Sei interessata/o allo sviluppo di progetti strategici e consulenziali in ambito data analysis, business intelligence e intelligenza artificiale?

Questa √® una fantastica opportunit√† per un giovane professionista che desidera entrare a far parte di un ambiente di lavoro collaborativo e dinamico, con la possibilit√† di lavorare con un team altamente specializzato e stakeholder di alto profilo.

L‚ÄôInnovation Hub √® parte del team Affinity, Mobility & DCS, dedicato allo sviluppo di soluzioni innovative e ad alto valore aggiunto per le diverse aree di business del mondo Motor. Attraverso l‚Äôadozione di tecnologie avanzate, tra cui strumenti di intelligenza artificiale, l‚Äôhub gestisce progetti volti a ottimizzare processi e attivit√† aziendali. L‚Äôarea Mobility/Mobility Innovation Hub ti offrir√† un percorso formativo nel mondo della consulenza e della gestione dei dati, con ampie possibilit√† di crescita professionale.

Si tratta di un ruolo ibrido che pu√≤ offrire la flessibilit√† di lavorare in parte virtualmente e in parte presso la nostra sede di Milano.

Aon is the business of better decisions.

In Aon, diamo forma alle decisioni migliori per proteggere e arricchire la vita delle persone in tutto il mondo. Siamo un‚Äôorganizzazione fondata sulla fiducia reciproca e sulla diversit√†, aiutiamo con passione i nostri colleghi e clienti ad avere successo.

Come sar√† la giornata tipo?

Il Data & BI Analyst √® la figura che supporta l‚Äôarea Mobility/Mobility Innovation Hub nella gestione e valorizzazione dei dati, contribuendo all‚Äôefficienza operativa e alla qualit√† delle decisioni aziendali.

Attivit√† Svolte

  • Gestione dei flussi informativi da e verso stakeholder interni (IT, Business Unit) ed esterni (Clienti, Compagnie);
  • Creazione di analisi e dashboard per la visualizzazione e condivisione dei dati;
  • Orchestrazione e automazione dei processi di ingestion, data cleaning e normalizzazione in collaborazione con i team IT;
  • Supporto all‚Äôadozione di soluzioni basate su intelligenza artificiale per l‚Äôanalisi predittiva e l‚Äôottimizzazione dei processi.

Quali sono le competenze ed esperienze richieste?

  • Laureandi/Laurea triennale e/o magistrale in discipline STEM, economiche o affini;
  • Esperienza pregressa (anche breve) in ambito data analysis o BI costituisce un plus;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei principali pacchetti Office (in particolare Excel e PowerPoint);
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di BI (es. Power BI, Tableau) e linguaggi di elaborazione dati (es. SQL, Python);
  • Conoscenza di base o interesse per strumenti di intelligenza artificiale e machine learning √® considerata un vantaggio;
  • Ottimo livello di inglese scritto e parlato;
  • Completano il profilo: curiosit√†, proattivit√†, precisione, orientamento al risultato, buone capacit√† relazionali e organizzative, attitudine al team working.

Come supportiamo i nostri colleghi?

La nostra organizzazione aperta ed inclusiva consente, grazie all‚Äôapproccio agile e alla modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, di gestire l'equilibrio tra lavoro e vita privata assicurando ad ogni collega di poter dare il meglio di s√©. Inoltre, annualmente sono previsti due "Global Wellbeing Days", in modo da poter dedicare del tempo al proprio benessere.

La nostra cultura sostiene un ambiente di lavoro innovativo e diversificato in cui tutti i colleghi, sentendosi s√© stessi, sono ispirati e motivati ad imparare, condividere e sviluppare le proprie competenze.

Sede di lavoro: Milano, Via Ernesto Calindri 6.

Welcome to Starcasino ‚Äì Pioneers in Casino Entertainment

With over 30 years of experience, Starcasino is a leading, family-owned Belgian company in the casino and iGaming industry. Our brands‚Äîincluding Starcasino.be, Hotwin.be, Solcasino.es, and Starcasino.nl‚Äîare well known across Belgium, Spain, and the Netherlands. With more than 10 physical locations and a vibrant online presence, we're always looking for fresh energy to support our mission of delivering next-level gaming experiences.




The Role

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our data & insights team. Your primary responsibility will be to support business stakeholders with clear and actionable insights using Metabase. You'll play a key role in helping our teams make smarter decisions based on real data.




What You‚Äôll Do

Create and maintain dashboards and reports in Metabase
Work closely with marketing, product, and operations teams to provide insights and performance tracking
Analyze customer behavior, campaign performance, and platform trends
Assist in A/B testing and experiment evaluation
Ensure data quality and help optimize internal reporting processes




What We‚Äôre Looking For

A degree in a relevant field (e.g. statistics, computer science, economics, or related)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with Metabase (personal projects or internships are welcome)
Good knowledge of SQL
Eagerness to learn, ask questions, and grow within a data-driven environment
Fluent in English; Dutch or French is a plus
Must be based in Belgium and able to work in our office in Grimbergen




What We Offer

A dynamic and collaborative work environment in a growing industry
Competitive salary package with benefits
Full training and guidance from our marketing team.
A look behind the scenes of a fast-growing international company.
Work on-site in Grimbergen, with:
Free lunch every day
Unlimited snacks & drinks
A young, dynamic, and welcoming team




Ready to join the game?

Want to gain real-world data analyst experience and build your portfolio? Join our team and help shape the voice of Starcasino!

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualisation
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

Who We Are

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

The Opportunity

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.

Responsibilities


Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank‚Äôs digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization


Your Profile


Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills; ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.
Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.


What We Offer


Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.


Why Join Us?

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Are you a talented Data Analyst looking to take the next step in your career?

Amaris Consulting is seeking a motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Belgium. This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals with a keen analytical mindset, technical expertise, and strong communication skills to grow and make an impact in a dynamic, multicultural environment.




üî• Your Role:

Analyze data and create reports to help the business make decisions.
Build dashboards and visualizations to share insights.
Work with different teams to understand their data needs.
Make sure data is accurate and clean.
Present your findings to both technical and non-technical people.




üéØYour Profile:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field.
2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Good knowledge of SQL and data analysis tools (like Python or R).
Experience with data visualization tools (like Power BI or Tableau).
Team player with good communication skills.
Speak English and Dutch (bilingual) or English, French, and Dutch (trilingual).




üöÄ Advantages:

An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.




üí° We are an independent company that values:

Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.







Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, ‚Ä¶
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LACO is geen doorsnee IT-bedrijf. We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data & AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data & AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons √©cht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten √©n collega‚Äôs en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.




üõ†Ô∏è Wat je gaat doen:

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven √©cht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega‚Äôs uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.




üéØ Wat wij zoeken:

Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.




Extra punten als je ook ‚Ä¶

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.




üí° Wat wij bieden:

Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, ‚Ä¶
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt ‚Äî wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden ‚Ä¶




üì© Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?

Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje ‚Äì ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

We horen graag van je!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Can‚Äôt wait to make an impact on the world? You‚Äôre not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Our Reward Team helps clients navigate the total reward landscape in a tailor-made and result-oriented way. From developing rewards strategy to implementing innovative solutions, they bring together the right mix of expertise‚Äîcovering everything from reward, tax & legal, employee communication, to tech and processes.

Role Summary

In today‚Äôs reward landscape, data and analytics are becoming central drivers of change. Pay transparency and pay equity are rapidly gaining importance, accelerated by global legislation and the upcoming EU Pay Transparency Directive. At Deloitte, we help our clients prepare for these changes and achieve fair, transparent and effective reward strategies.

As a Rewards Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in this journey. Working as part of our multidisciplinary Global Employer Services (GES) reward team‚Äîwhich brings together experts in job architecture, job grading, tax & social security, people law, compensation, benefits, processes and reward technology‚Äîyou will help clients translate complex data into meaningful insights and actionable solutions.

We Are Looking For Both Junior And Senior Profiles


Junior Data Analyst: you will focus on preparing and executing analyses, supporting senior colleagues in delivering client-ready outputs.
Senior Data Analyst: in addition to performing analyses, you will review the work of junior colleagues, engage directly with clients, and contribute to shaping client deliverables and recommendations.


Key Responsibilities

Junior Data Analyst


Prepare reward and compensation datasets for analysis, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Conduct statistical and regression analyses under the guidance of senior colleagues.
Develop dashboards and visualisations (Power BI, R, Python) to support client discussions.
Draft initial reports and presentations for senior review.
Support the implementation of pay equity & transparency analyses.


Senior Data Analyst


Lead the design and execution of advanced reward analytics projects.
Review and validate analyses prepared by junior colleagues, ensuring quality and accuracy.
Translate findings into clear insights and recommendations for clients.
Engage directly with clients to present results and provide advice on next steps.
Act as a key contributor within Deloitte‚Äôs pay equity & transparency offering, helping clients adapt to evolving legislation (incl. EU Pay Transparency Directive).


Let‚Äôs Talk About You!


Strong interest to bring advanced analytics (and artificial intelligence) into our client solutions & applications
At least 1 - 3 years (junior profile) or 4 - 6 years (senior profile) of experience in data analytics
Experience in applying statistical techniques
Experience working with R or Python and Power BI (or other data visualisation tools)
Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably one additional language (Dutch or French)
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and data visualisation tools


Our story

Global Employer Services (GES) team is fully aware today‚Äôs digital revolution is rapidly rewriting the environment for employers and their global workforces. The need for mobility is greater than ever. We help our clients achieve control, gain perspective, and lead with confidence through this period of uncertainty and technological change. Our professionals focus on providing personal tax, compensation & benefits and international assignment/HR services to our clients. We assist our clients to streamline their HR, Mobility and Rewards programs, while managing tax effectiveness, compliance and employment costs, both in a global and domestic context.

Reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll advisory designed just for you! Our professionals help you design cost-effective, tax-efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs.

Our story - Global Employer Services (GES)

In today's digital revolution, the environment for employers and their (global) workforces is rapidly evolving, with an increased need for adaptability. The GES team is dedicated to helping clients navigate these challenges with confidence, providing expertise in rewards, compensation & benefits, personal tax and international assignment/HR services.

Our focus is on streamlining HR, Rewards and Mobility programs to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and cost management in both global and domestic contexts. We offer specialised advisory services in reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.

Our professionals are committed to designing cost-effective, efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs. We are here to support your journey towards pay transparency and equity, ensuring your compensation strategies are both attractive to employees and beneficial for your business.

Why work in GES?


Passion: Driven by a love for mobility, payroll, and rewards services, crafting both local and global solutions in a sustainable way.
People-focused: Working with and for people. Investing in coaching, learning, and developing the team, making sure everyone grows.
Professionalism: Delivering excellence as a united team, ensuring success for their clients and for each other.


Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:


My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities


Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality


Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Graphic Packaging International, we produce the paper cup that held your coffee this morning, the basket that transported those bottles of craft beer you enjoyed last weekend, and the microwave tray that heated your gourmet meal last night. We‚Äôre one of the largest manufacturers of paperboard and paper-based packaging for some of the world‚Äôs most recognised brands of food, beverage, food service, household, personal care and pet products. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, we are collaborative, diverse, innovative individuals who create inspired packaging while giving back to our communities.




With over 25,000 employees working in more than 130 locations worldwide, we strive to be environmentally responsible in our industry and in the communities where we operate. We are committed to workplace diversity and offer compensation and benefits programs that are among the industry‚Äôs best to reward the talented people who make our company successful.

A World of Difference. Made Possible.




Job Purpose

As an Aurora Data Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting the Aurora program by coordinating the extraction, transformation, and migration of master and transactional data from legacy systems into Aurora Radius. You‚Äôll work closely with local sites, external vendors, and internal teams to ensure data integrity and seamless integration. Your deep understanding of GPI‚Äôs business processes will be essential in translating operational needs into effective data solutions.




Are you passionate about data, systems integration, and making a real impact in business transformation? Join our dynamic team as an Aurora Data Analyst and help shape the future of our data landscape!




üîç What You‚Äôll Do

As part of the Aurora program, you‚Äôll:

Coordinate data extraction and transformation from legacy systems.
Lead ETL processes and final data migration during go-live.
Collaborate with local sites, vendors, and internal teams to ensure accurate data loads into Aurora Radius.
Work hands-on with transactional data: Sales Orders, Purchase Orders, Inventory, WIP.
Travel to sites during rollout phases to support data conversion and cutover.
Ensure all processes are documented and audit-compliant.

üìä Your Impact

Deliver accurate, timely Power BI reports.
Improve data accessibility and quality across departments.
Automate manual reporting processes.
Ensure seamless integration of new data sources.

üß† What You Bring

Advanced ETL and SQL skills.
Experience with relational databases and large datasets.
Knowledge of manufacturing and business processes.
Familiarity with Power Apps and Xlink tools.
Strong communication and problem-solving abilities.
Willingness to travel and support go-live activities on-site.

ü§ù Who You Are

Self-motivated and reliable.
Quality and safety conscious.
Collaborative and eager to learn.
Excellent communicator with a strong work ethic.







What We Offer

Joining our team means becoming part of a forward-thinking organization where your skills and ideas truly matter. As an Aurora Data Analyst, you‚Äôll enjoy:

‚úÖ Competitive Compensation ‚Äì A salary package that reflects your experience and impact.

‚úÖ Growth Opportunities ‚Äì Access to training, certifications, and career development within a global transformation program.

‚úÖ Collaborative Culture ‚Äì Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment.

‚úÖ Travel & Exposure ‚Äì Be part of a high-visibility project with opportunities to travel and engage directly with local sites.

‚úÖ Work-Life Balance ‚Äì Flexible working arrangements where possible, with recognition of your time and commitment during go-live phases.

‚úÖ Cutting-Edge Tools ‚Äì Work with modern technologies like Power BI, SQL, Power Apps, and Radius.







Ready to make a difference? Apply now and be part of a trans formative journey with the Aurora program!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong expertise in data warehousing and modelling to support data-driven initiatives within a banking environment. The analyst will work closely with business stakeholders, architects, and delivery teams to translate complex business needs into reliable and scalable data solutions.




Responsibilities:

Analyse and challenge business requirements and translate them into structured functional and technical specifications
Collaborate with Solution Architects to ensure alignment with existing data architecture
Model and document data structures using 3NF and dimensional modelling (Kimball methodology)
Support the design, validation, and optimisation of ETL processes
Conduct impact analysis and formulate clear solution proposals
Maintain consistent and structured documentation of requirements, models, and solutions
Support testing and validation activities (e.g. defect analysis, UAT follow-up)
Contribute to knowledge sharing, peer reviews, and team improvement efforts
Actively participate in Agile ceremonies (e.g. sprint planning, retrospectives)
Identify data-related risks and ensure compliance with internal governance and security standards




Profile:

Master‚Äôs degree (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or functional analyst in a complex environment
Deep knowledge of data modelling techniques: 3NF, Kimball/star schema (facts/dimensions)
Strong SQL skills and solid experience with ETL tools
Experience with Oracle and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) is a strong asset
Knowledge of Data Vault modelling is a plus
Able to work independently and provide structured input to project teams
Precise, analytical, and solution-focused approach
Fluent in Dutch (mandatory), with a good command of English or French




About Dynafin Consulting

DynaFin is a consulting company with 15 years of experience in delivering high quality services to one single sector: Financial Services. We have built a team of > 150 financial services experts in Belgium, Luxembourg and France, passionate to support the sustainable transformation of the financial industry.

DynaFin advises this key sector of the global economy to boost its operating performance and innovate for the future.




We provide unique and pragmatic solutions to address market challenges, bundled in 5 DynaFin core expertises:

‚Ä¢ Business Model Innovation

‚Ä¢ Enterprise Operating Performance

‚Ä¢ Regulatory Compliance

‚Ä¢ Risk Management

‚Ä¢ Technology




Since 2017, DynaFin is part of Alan Allman Associates, a worldwide ecosystem of 20 strong brands specialized in strategy and digital transformation, representing 3.200 Consultants. AAA aims to bring together the expertise of its brands, allowing DynaFin to create integrated end to end services for our customers

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For thousands of years, MAPS have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a MAPS Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately, resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge, a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!

Ideal candidate


Fluent in English and Dutch.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Belgium.
Analytical mindset.


Job requirements


Must be living in Belgium for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, MAP applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.


Benefits


Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Apply online today!

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone‚Äôs effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.


Fincons is looking for a BUSINESS, PROCESS and DATA ANALYST


We are seeking a professional with a hybrid background in business analysis, data analytics, and service operations, capable of translating operational performance data into actionable business insights. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in supporting business operations through analytical frameworks, continuous service improvement, and structured governance.

Familiarity with ITSM practices remains essential, but the emphasis is on their application in business support environments, such as finance, HR, logistics, or customer service.


TASKS


Following tasks will be performed by external service provider:

‚Ä¢ Understand the overall customs processes in order to be able to determine the required IT

requirements. More explicitly, the relationships between the customs business layer and the

IT service layer are of major importance;

‚Ä¢ Prepare project plan, execute & follow-up, discuss and negotiate with all stakeholders

SoftDev, ITSM, internal teams etc.

‚Ä¢ Participate and contribute in brainstorming, meetings, trainings and workshops with contractors and/or other partners;

‚Ä¢ Organise and lead project-related meetings, including webinars, trainings, workshops

‚Ä¢ Support projects by designing services and components (or supervising contractors' design),

encouraging re-use as well as committing that the design of the system will fulfil the

requirements;

‚Ä¢ Define in close collaboration with the contractors and the systems‚Äô stakeholders the

requirements, in particular non-functional requirements (volume, scalability,

confidentiality, integrity, availability, business continuity and disaster recovery planning);

‚Ä¢ Analyse the integration of different information systems and ensure their interoperability;

‚Ä¢ Produce and/or review project related documents (including Function Point reports).

‚Ä¢ Discuss and coordinate business aspects of the assigned IT projects with various

stakeholders (DG TAXUD business and IT teams, contractors' teams, COTS providers,

Member States' representatives, etc.). Understanding of the applicable legislation, the

business and the functional requirements;

‚Ä¢ Determine the IT requirements and translate them into an action and project plan;

‚Ä¢ Enforce the delivery of the project(s) according to the agreed schedule, with the expected

quality and with the resources provided;

‚Ä¢ Ensuring maximum uptime, accurate and early incident response, appropriate configuration

management, proactive maintenance and tuning;

‚Ä¢ The monitoring and reporting on operations and on capacity consumption, and liaison with

all (internal and external) stakeholders;

‚Ä¢ The definition of KPIs, as well as the monitoring and reporting on all quality indicators.

‚Ä¢ Report on the service status (SLA, actions, risks, issues, decisions, changes, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Follow-up of the activities of the DG TAXUD contractors:

o Support the preparation of technical annexes to setup the contractual activities;

o Coordinate project related matters with the contractors and other stakeholders;

o Supervise the production of the deliverables and the required level of quality;

o Review the periodically produced reports related to the assigned projects.

‚Ä¢ Report on the project status (tasks progress, plan, actions, risks, issues, decisions, changes,

etc.).



REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE

‚Ä¢ Minimum experience of 10 years in IT systems out of which 5 years within customs environment

performing systems analysis or project management activities;

‚Ä¢ Deep IT technical knowledge in areas of networking (TCP/IP), Linux, databases, IT security,

programming languages and web based applications;

‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of service interfaces and service data;

‚Ä¢ Experience of large scale IT systems integration projects;

‚Ä¢ Knowledge and experience in platforms like CCN1, CCN2 etc. is an asset;

‚Ä¢ Experience with distributed IT systems is an asset;

‚Ä¢ Prior experience with conformance testing is an asset;

‚Ä¢ Ability to work autonomously is mandatory;

‚Ä¢ Experience in international/multicultural environment and public administration are assets;

‚Ä¢ Ability to give business and technical presentations

‚Ä¢ Very good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences;

‚Ä¢ Analysis and problem-solving skills;

‚Ä¢ Capability to write clear and structured technical documents;

‚Ä¢ Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills.


SPECIFIC EXPERTISE

‚Ä¢ Oracle SQL developer;

‚Ä¢ Soap UI and Ready API;

‚Ä¢ ALM tools: Jira, Nexus, Confluence.


English (C1) required


Office: Brussels

modality of work: near-site


If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Title: Investment Data Analyst
Description:
Context

The Junior Investment Data Analyst is a member of the Investment Strategy Group (ISG) and works under supervision of the Chief Market Strategist for Indosuez Wealth Management (IWM). They oversee the data-warehouse rules and processes for the categorization of financial instruments (Bonds, Equities, Funds) within the Securities Master File (SMF) used by Indosuez Wealth Management Solutions (WMS), as well as the exposures tool within Private Banking.

Your position

Sustainable Finance Related Categories

As part of the Sustainable finance governance of IWM and in close cooperation with the Responsible Investment Competence Centre (RICC) and the DPAM Quant Team, he or she will oversee the process for the Sustainable finance related categories that are relevant for WMS. He or she will also oversee new projects, in particular the design the Funds Data Hub, the next generation fund transparency tool, that is being developed in close cooperation with IWM Third-Party Funds team.

BE specific: MiFID related categories:

Being part of the ISG and as analysts who understand the nature of financial instruments, he or she oversees the rules governing the input at creation of certain MiFID related categories in the dedicated individual fields of the bank‚Äôs Securities Master File (SMF).

IWM Exposures Tool

He or she oversees the tool detailing the exposure of Private Banking to Financial Instruments Exposure (Equities, Bonds, Funds). The tool details exposure by Country, type of Mandate, number of clients‚Ä¶ The tool regroups financial instruments to show exposure by issuer, credit rating, region, sector‚Ä¶

Key Member Of The Investment Strategy Group (ISG)


As part of his activities, the Junior Investment Data Analyst:
Implements data quality rules under the supervision of the Chief Data Office (CDO)
Participates to Sustainable Finance related workgroups and
Together with Chief Sustainability Officer, Chief Market Strategist and relevant compliance officers, further develop WMS Exclusion, ESG and Impact methodologies
Together with the relevant project teams, participates to the continuous optimization of workflows
Follows-up on questions from the second line (Compliance Monitoring Process or CMP) or the third line (Audit)


Your profile


Bachelor or master‚Äôs in Business Management, Finance or any related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to assimilate a large amount of information
A critical and synthetic mind, demonstrated proactive mindset
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Dutch and/or French
Team player and the ability to communicate easily
Flexible and autonomous in the way of working
Knowledge or first experience working with visualization tools, ideally PowerBI or SQL, Python being a great asset


Our offer

For more than 150 years, Degroof Petercam has been a reference investment house. Entrepreneurship is our DNA, expertise is our fuel. You will become part of a company with highly skilled, talented and passionate experts that aim for nothing less than excellence. The impact of our work goes beyond profit by looking at business from a broader perspective, challenging those who want to intellectually. As a part of Indosuez Wealth Management and Cr√©dit Agricole, we offer our people ongoing learning and development and mobility on an international scale.

In addition to our fascinating work environment, we also offer:


A broad offer of learning & development programs including a Degroof Petercam Academy for both professional and personal goals.
An attractive and market conform compensation package
Flexible working hours & teleworking
An Employee Social Engagement Program
Access to the same Private Banking Expertise as our clients

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en √©cht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.




Wat ga je doen?

Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologie√´n en methodes binnen de datawereld




Wie zoeken we?

Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid




Wat mag je verwachten?

Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen




Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

Show more

Title: BI Analyst ‚Äì Remote-First
Description:
üöÄ Be part of a movement to change the way Europe pays

In today‚Äôs digital world, payments often still feel outdated: random delays and confusing rules make it harder than it should be to pay and get paid. The European Payments Initiative (EPI) is here to change all that, forever.

With Wero, our digital wallet, we make sending and receiving money simple, seamless and secure across France, Belgium and Germany, with more countries and omnichannel solutions coming soon. Supported by 14 major banks and the two largest European acquirers, EPI is building a new, proudly European payment system: easy, instant and transparent, all for the greater good.


üîé What's in it for you

Join us as our next Business Intelligence Analyst, bridging Finance and Data to convert raw figures into actionable insights, owning the SQL + Python pipelines in Azure and Databricks that fuel our financial dashboards, billing engines, and senior management insights. You will work closely with finance analysts, business stakeholders, and other technical teams to deliver data-driven insights and make data-informed decisions.


üêù About the team

You‚Äôll join a team of 3 talented Data Analytics experts based in the Netherlands, within the Finance department. Each team member brings unique skills and perspectives, fostering a rich learning environment.


üíª Technology stack

SQL, Power BI, Azure Cloud, Python, Databricks


üí• Your impact

Build & enhance financial reporting: Design new dashboards, reports, and self-service datasets for P&L, cash-flow, and margin analysis
Maintain operational calculations: Own monthly billing, revenue-recognition, and commission-calculation pipelines. Implement automated data-quality checks and reconciliation controls
Data modeling & pipeline engineering: ‚Ä¢ Develop medallion-architecture tables in Databricks (bronze/silver/gold)
Stakeholder collaboration: Translate finance requirements into technical specs. Train finance analysts on new datasets and BI tools
Continuous improvement & governance: Champion cost-optimization and FinOps best practices in Cloud platforms
Work across several legal entities: harmonization of data models and reporting standards to present a single source of truth


üïµüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements

+3 years of hands-on experience writing advanced SQL, including window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and performance tuning
Proficiency in Python for data wrangling and automation
Practical experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex financial concepts into clear technical requirements
A proactive mindset with a strong bias for automation and thorough documentation
Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau

Nice to have:

Familiarity with dbt (data build tool)
Exposure to machine learning techniques for forecasting or anomaly detection
Understanding of financial analytics and reporting


ü™ú If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:

A first call with one of our recruiters
Possibly, a business case or a tech assessment
A technical interview with the hiring manager
A final interview with the Chief of Finance
Hopefully, an offer you can‚Äôt refuse


‚õî Turn back if ‚Ä¶


You don't have advanced experience with SQL and visualization tools
You cannot translate able to navigate from business to technical challenges




Otherwise apply!




ü´∂ Our commitment to equal employment opportunities


EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Amaris Consulting is looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels

üìù Your Responsibilities:



Analyze and interpret large datasets to support business decisions.
Create dashboards and reports to communicate insights.
Collaborate with technical and business teams.
Ensure data quality and reliability.



üë§ Your Profile:



Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs in a relevant field.
Experience as a Data Analyst.
Skilled in SQL, Python or R, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Fluent in Dutch and English (French is a plus).
Dutch proficiency is mandatory. You must be bilingual (Dutch/English) or trilingual (Dutch, English, French).



üöÄ Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



üí° We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

  • Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
  • International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
  • Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
  • Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.


Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Functional Data Analyst Consultant




Permanent contract




FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You‚Äôll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.







Check out some of our ongoing projects:

Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.

If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let‚Äôs meet up if they match your profile!







Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:

Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Turning Data Management into practice.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.







Who you are:

Your interest & soft skills

A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Autonomous and solutions oriented.
Dynamic team player.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English.




Your technical experience

At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.
Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Proficient reporting and documentation skills.
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.










Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular ‚ÄúGuild‚Äù workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities.
We may work with tomorrow‚Äôs technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification.
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid ways of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels.
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances‚Ä¶
Read more about the benefits we offer here.




Apply now

We can't wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a team driving the energy transition and help build a sustainable, reliable, and green electricity system. Working alongside experts in market modelling and system adequacy, you‚Äôll contribute to key studies that shape the future of the energy grid and support Europe‚Äôs security of supply goals.




What you will do:

You‚Äôll be part of the Market Analysis team, contributing to a broader, forward-looking study required under European regulation to assess non-fossil flexibility needs for the next 5‚Äì10 years. Your tasks will include:

RES Integration Assessment: analyze curtailment and residual load statistics using economic dispatch results.
Ramping Needs Assessment: evaluate hourly ramping requirements and assess whether technologies can meet them.
Short-Term Flexibility Assessment: study system needs to cover unexpected demand/generation variations or outages.
Data Preparation & Reporting: ensure consistency across adequacy studies, outlooks, and flexibility indicators.
Methodology Development: implement regulatory requirements into concrete, quantified indicators.
Tooling & Automation: improve scripts and workflows in R/Python/Excel/VBA to process large datasets (10GB+).
Visualization & Communication: prepare clear visuals and statistics to present results to stakeholders.




What are we looking for?

You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a relevant role.
Strong skills in R or Python (must have; both is a plus).
Experience with data handling, statistical analysis, and scripting.
Good command of Excel (must have); VBA is a plus.
Knowledge of economic dispatch tools such as ANTARES is an advantage.
Experience with electricity market modelling or flexibility studies is a plus.
Knowledge of and genuine interest in the energy market.
Analytical mindset with problem-solving and innovative thinking.
Able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Passion for the energy transition and delivering high-quality tools.
Fluent in French or Dutch, plus fluent in English.




What do we offer?

Location: Hybrid

Contract: Freelance // 4 months

Start: September 1st 2025

Title: Data Analyst - no Experience Required
Description:
For thousands of years, MAPS have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a MAPS Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

Your responsabilities


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct.
You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately, resulting in better user experiences.
With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office.
The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge, a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Job requirements


Must be living in Belgium for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, MAP applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.


Ideal candidate:


Fluent in English and Dutch
Excellent research skills
Excellent local knowledge of your home country
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Belgium
Analytical mindset


Benefits


Work up to 20 hours per week
Earn a competitive rate of pay
Develop your research skills
Avoid the long commute
Work from the comfort of your home office
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours


Apply online today!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Robert Half is momenteel op zoek naar een Data Analyst (m/v/x) voor een bedrijf actief in de pharma sector. Onze klant is gelegen in Mechelen.


De verantwoordelijkheden voor deze functie zijn:

  • Je verzamelt en analyseert relevante markt- en cijferinformatie om strategische beslissingen en business cases te ondersteunen;
  • Je werkt grondige business cases uit, inclusief scenarioanalyses en levensvatbaarheidscriteria;
  • Je ondersteunt het beheer en de optimalisatie van het CRM-systeem en online bestelsystemen in samenwerking met interne en externe stakeholders;
  • Je beheert product- en klantendatabanken, inclusief prijzen en kortingen, vanuit het CRM-systeem en andere bestelsystemen;
  • Je ontwikkelt standaard- en ad-hoc rapporten om interne behoeften te vervullen en stakeholders te ondersteunen;
  • Je verhoogt de effici√´ntie door rapporten en dashboards te standaardiseren en te optimaliseren;
  • Je presenteert analytische bevindingen en aanbevelingen aan het leiderschapsteam voor strategische besluitvorming;
  • Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de BI/BD Director.


Wat breng je mee?

  • Je hebt een achtergrond in bedrijfseconomie, ondersteund door een diploma;
  • Je beschikt over 2 tot 3 jaar relevante werkervaring;
  • Je hebt bewezen ervaring in het opstellen van business cases;
  • Je beheerst het Nederlands, Frans en Engels vlot;
  • Je bent zeer vaardig met MS Office, met name Excel (Pivot, DAX) en Power BI;
  • Je bent analytisch, probleemoplossend, en beschikt over commercieel inzicht;
  • Je denkt autonoom, werkt nauwkeurig en kan goed samenwerken met verschillende teams;
  • Je bent enthousiast en gedreven, en weet bruggen te bouwen tussen collega's.


Aanbod:

  • Een boeiende functie bij een bedrijf dat kiest voor een mensgerichte aanpak binnen de gezondheidszorg;
  • De kans om bij te dragen aan innovatieve oplossingen die welzijn en comfort verbeteren;
  • Een omgeving waar je collega's en klanten centraal staan, en iedere medewerker gewaardeerd wordt;
  • Een stimulerende bedrijfscultuur met een sterke focus op groei, samenwerking en het doorbreken van traditionele processen;
  • Competitieve arbeidsvoorwaarden en volop ruimte voor professionele ontwikkeling.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.




‚úÖ Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources.
Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.




üéâ What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.




Job requirements




üîé The profile

You have at least 2 years experience.
You have worked on a data visualisation project in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.




üí™ The Skills

You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have experience in working with Power BI in a professional setting.
You have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R and cloud platforms AWS, GCP and Azure.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You possess both strong technical abilities and soft skills to align technical- and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak fluent English and either Dutch or French.




üí∞ The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...
Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




üìç Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




üéØ Ready to join Dataroots?

Ready for a new chapter as a Data Analyst at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! üéâ

Title: AI/DATA Business Analyst
Description:
Don‚Äôt settle for just any consulting company, choose the one that‚Äôs right for you!




We‚Äôre on the lookout for a AI/DATA Business Analyst to join our expanding AI & Data start-up.




As Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.




You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.

However, this isn‚Äôt the job for you if you‚Äôre looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. üöÄ

As a AI/DATA Business Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the crossroads between business and technology. Your mission will be to:

Dive deep into business needs and turn them into clear, actionable requirements.
Take full ownership of projects, making sure stakeholders stay aligned and delivery stays on track.
Work hand-in-hand with our technical teams to shape solution architectures and create documentation that helps development move smoothly.

You‚Äôre a step closer to joining our team if you bring:

Background:

A bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (business, engineering, or similar).
2‚Äì4 years of experience in a business analyst or project manager role.
Hands-on experience in a data or AI project (a big plus for us).

Technical Skills:

A solid understanding of project management approaches, especially Agile and Scrum.

Soft Skills:

Strong communication skills, comfortable talking with both business and tech stakeholders.
The ability to translate business needs into technical requirements, and vice versa.
A structured approach to project management and delivery.

Practical Info:

Languages: Fluent English, plus native proficiency in either French or Dutch.

We know that finding the right job isn‚Äôt just about the role, it‚Äôs about what‚Äôs in it for you, too. While we‚Äôre a start-up, we‚Äôre big on taking care of our people right from day one.

Here‚Äôs a sneak peek at what we offer:

We‚Äôre on the lookout for a AI/DATA Business Analyst to join our expanding AI & Data start-up.


As Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.


You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.

However, this isn‚Äôt the job for you if you‚Äôre looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. üöÄ

As a AI/DATA Business Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the crossroads between business and technology. Your mission will be to:

  • Dive deep into business needs and turn them into clear, actionable requirements.
  • Take full ownership of projects, making sure stakeholders stay aligned and delivery stays on track.
  • Work hand-in-hand with our technical teams to shape solution architectures and create documentation that helps development move smoothly.

Soft Skills:

  • The ability to translate business needs into technical requirements, and vice versa.

Practical Info:

  • Languages: Fluent English, plus native proficiency in either French or Dutch.
