Title: Reward Data Analyst
Description:
Can‚Äôt wait to make an impact on the world?¬†You‚Äôre not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Our¬†Reward Team¬†helps clients navigate the
total reward landscape in a tailor-made and result-oriented way. From
developing rewards strategy to implementing innovative solutions such as the EU
Pay Transparency Directive. They bring together the right mix of expertise‚Äîcovering
everything from reward, tax & legal, employee communication, to tech and
process.

Role Summary:¬†

As a Rewards Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in
supporting our clients' rewards and compensation & benefits strategies. You
will leverage your analytical skills and statistical expertise to
provide insights and solutions that drive pay transparency and equity. This
position offers an exciting opportunity to work with a multidisciplinary team
and contribute to impactful projects that shape the future of reward systems.

Key Responsibilities:

Conduct comprehensive reward & compensation
analyses using statistical methods and regression models.
Pivotal member of our pay equity & transparency
team (see more information: Pay
Transparency and Pay Equity)
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to
implement pay equity & transparency initiatives.
Utilise R and Python for data analysis and
visualisation to support reward strategies.
Assist in the development of tailored reward
programs that align with organisational goals.
Prepare detailed reports and presentations to
communicate findings and recommendations.
Support the implementation of innovative
solutions such as the EU Pay Transparency Directive.

Let‚Äôs Talk About You!

At least 1 ‚Äì 3 years (junior profile) or 4 - 6 years (senior profile) of experience in data analytics.

Experience in applying statistical techniques

Experience working with R, Python and Power BI.

Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably one additional language (Dutch or French).

Strong analytical skills with proficiency in compensation analysis, market benchmarking tools, benefits management systems, Excel, PowerPoint, HRIS, and data visualisation tools.

Demonstrated ability to think strategically, innovate, provide high-impact solutions, and effectively manage projects to successful completion.


Global Employer Services (GES) team is fully aware today‚Äôs digital revolution is rapidly rewriting the environment for employers and their global workforces. The need for mobility is greater than ever. We help our clients achieve control, gain perspective, and lead with confidence through this period of uncertainty and technological change. Our professionals focus on providing personal tax, compensation & benefits and international assignment/HR services to our clients. We assist our clients to streamline their HR, Mobility and Rewards programs, while managing tax effectiveness, compliance and employment costs, both in a global and domestic context.
Reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll advisory designed just for you! Our professionals help you design cost-effective, tax-efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs.
Our story - Global Employer Services (GES)
In today's digital revolution, the environment for employers and their (global) workforces is rapidly evolving, with an increased need for adaptability. The GES team is dedicated to helping clients navigate these challenges with confidence, providing expertise in rewards, compensation & benefits, personal tax and international assignment/HR services.
Our focus is on streamlining HR, Rewards and Mobility programs to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and cost management in both global and domestic contexts. We offer specialised advisory services in reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.
Our professionals are committed to designing cost-effective, efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs. We are here to support your journey towards pay transparency and equity, ensuring your compensation strategies are both attractive to employees and beneficial for your business.

Why work in GES?

Passion: Driven by a love for mobility, payroll, and rewards services, crafting both local and global solutions in a sustainable way.

People-focused: Working with and for people. Investing in coaching, learning, and developing the team, making sure everyone grows.

Professionalism: Delivering excellence as a united team, ensuring success for their clients and for each other.


Who is Deloitte?
We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.
In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:


My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities

Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte

Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte

Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte

Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities


Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality

Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).

Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Quality Analyst, you‚Äôll support our clients with their data quality needs:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
You know all about the SQL.
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶




ABOUT US




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our recruiters and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? üöÄüåç

At TEKEVER, we lead innovation in Europe as the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation.

üíª Digital | üõ°Ô∏è Defence | üîí Security | üõ∞Ô∏è Space

We operate across four strategic areas, combining artificial intelligence, systems engineering, data science, and aerospace technology to tackle global challenges ‚Äî from protecting people and critical infrastructure to exploring space.

We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that delivers real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. Our products and services support strategic and operational decisions in the most demanding environments ‚Äî whether at sea, on land, in space, or in cyberspace.

üåê Become part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary, and mission-driven team that is transforming maritime surveillance and redefining global safety standards.

At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to empower critical decision-making.

If you're passionate about technology and eager to shape the future ‚Äî TEKEVER is the place for you. üëáüèªüéØ

Job Overview

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to the development, implementation, and optimization of advanced algorithms and models and data understanding. Your work will support key teams such as Field Operations, R&D, Flights, Simulation, Autopilot by automating workflows and enhancing decision support, mission planning, and situational awareness capabilities.

What Will Be Your Responsibilities


Conduct in-depth analysis to identify patterns, anomalies, and insights across multi-modal datasets.
Present analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences, including stakeholders and leadership.
Translate business challenges into analytical solutions and data strategies.
Build and fit statistical and machine learning models; evaluate and refine them for performance.
Develop interactive dashboards for situational awareness using tools like Power BI and Grafana.
Collaborate with data engineers to optimize pipelines and ensure scalable, real-time data workflows.
Perform ad-hoc analysis for strategic decision support.
Ensure high standards of data integrity and accuracy.
Create intelligible reports with actionable conclusions and clear visualizations.
Integrate and analyse data from diverse sources including drone sensors, GIS, and real-time systems.
Partner with data scientists to monitor and enhance the performance of deployed models.


Profile And Requirements


Education
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fields.
A Ph.D. is a plus.
Experience
3+ years in data science or machine learning, especially with time series or predictive modeling.
Strong experience handling sensor data, GIS, unstructured text, and other multi-modal data types.
Familiarity with mission-critical domains such as field ops, aviation, or defense is highly valued.
Proven ability to build, deploy, and monitor machine learning models in production.
Experience working on real-time dashboards and decision systems.
Technical Skills
Programming & Software Engineering
Advanced proficiency in Python for data scripting, analysis, and automation.
Strong grasp of software engineering practices, including version control (Git) and DevOps basics.
Data Frameworks & Libraries
Hands-on experience with Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn for data manipulation and modeling.
Familiarity with ETL processes, database design, and vector database applications.
Data Storage & Querying
Strong command of SQL for complex data retrieval and optimization.
Experience working with DBMS, data warehousing, and cloud data storage (especially GCP).
Modeling & Statistical Analysis
Solid foundation in statistics: regression, hypothesis testing, distribution analysis.
Skilled in model fitting, feature engineering, and performance evaluation.
Data Visualization & Dashboarding
Expert in Power BI, Grafana, Looker, Streamlit, Gradio for reporting and dashboards.
Experience with Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly for advanced visual storytelling.
Strong data communication and storytelling capabilities.
Geospatial & Sensor Analytics
Experience with GIS systems, drone sensors, and tools such as GeoPandas, Rasterio, QGIS.
Ability to extract and interpret spatial and time-series insights.
Cloud & Deployment
Familiar with Google Cloud Platform and deployment of analytics/data tools on cloud infrastructure.
Other Requirements
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a sharp eye for operational and strategic insight.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively in a high-paced, multidisciplinary environment.
Awareness of AI ethics, fairness, and bias mitigation best practices.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills for cross-functional collaboration.

What We Have To Offer You


An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world;
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics;
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems;
Flexible work arrangements;
Professional development opportunities;
Collaborative and inclusive work environment;
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.


TEKEVER is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Do you want to know more about us ?

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

Title: Data analyst PowerBI & SAP BO (Freelance)
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Power BI Expert for our client in the financial sector. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in Power BI, and the ability to translate complex data into meaningful insights.

The consultant will work as a Power BI Expert within the Cash development team (6 people).

The overall project involves:


Migrating the data from the CashSSP datawarehouse to the cloud.
Converting a large number of static PDF reports (SAP BO) into Power BI reports that meet the same business requirements.



This new data warehouse will be leveraged by 12 European countries, making it a crucial tool for strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.

Key Responsabilities

1. Coaching & Mentoring (50%)

You will dedicate approximately half of your time coaching and mentoring a team composed of IT developers and less experienced business users. Your role will be to guide them in improving their skills, adopting best practices, and deepening their understanding of Power BI data modeling and data visualization.

2. Data Modeling & Report Development (50%)

The remaining portion of your role will focus on:


Designing, implementing, and maintaining robust semantic models to support scalable, performant, consistent reporting including support for self-service analytics by business users.
Developing and optimizing Power BI reports and dashboards that deliver clear insights aligned with business requirements. Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure the alignment of technical solutions with business objectives.



Required Skills & Qualifications

1. Coaching & BI Expertise


Proven experience as a Power BI Expert in a complex, enterprise environment.
Power BI certification is a strong asset.
Expertise in DAX, Power Query, and Power BI Desktop/Service.
Experience in creating paginated reports is a plus.
Strong communication and mentoring skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Team-oriented mindset and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with Azure or other cloud platforms is preferred.
Knowledge of SAP BO to analyze existing reports is considered as a significant advantage



2. Semantic Modeling


Solid experience in data modeling, data transformation, and data integration.
Ability to design semantic layers that ensure data consistency and performance.
Knowledge of Row-Level Security (RLS) implementation in a multi-country, multi-user environment.
Understanding of different data connectivity modes (Import, DirectQuery, Live Connection) and when to use them.
Experience with Power BI deployment pipelines, workspace structuring, and lifecycle management.



3. Report Development


Strong understanding of data visualization best practices, including layout, user experience, and accessibility.
Ability to translate business requirements into impactful dashboards and visuals.
(Optional) Experience working directly with business stakeholders to gather and refine reporting needs.

Title: Aviation Energy Data Analyst
Description:
IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN THIS ROLE, PLEASE APPLY VIA OUR WEBSITE FOLLOWING THIS LINK : https://jobs.transportenvironment.org/o/aviation-energy-data-analyst




Your application won't be taking into consideration if you only apply via LinkedIn, thanks.










ü´µRole: Aviation Energy Data Analyst

üìç Location: Brussels

üìÖ Application Deadline: 05/09/2025

‚úíÔ∏è Start Date: ASAP







Are you concerned by transport‚Äôs climate impact and continued reliance on fossil fuels? Have you got experience in how the electricity system will need to adapt to cope with the changes to both supply and additional demand? T&E is looking for a talented and dynamic data analyst to join the team to work on electro-sustainable aviation fuels (e-SAF). The electrification of transport and acceleration of the deployment of renewable energy will create both challenges and opportunities in the green transition. The analyst will work alongside the shipping and energy team to build a case for e-fuels to use in transport‚Äôs hard-to-abate sectors.




Aviation is a challenging sector to decarbonize. We‚Äôre looking for a data analyst to research available aviation decarbonization options, using data and research to inform policy and financial instruments in order to deliver the required fuels. We need convincing and compelling charts, analysis, reports and presentations to convert complex information into advocacy and media friendly material. Finally, we need to convince European lawmakers to set ambitious but achievable goals to drive the sector from being the fastest growing climate problem to one of sustainability.




This position requires an engineer or scientist with experience in environmental science, energy systems or related fields.







Main functions of the role:




‚óè Taking a leading role on T&E‚Äôs analytical work on green energy for aviation

‚óè Compiling robust and compelling data, evidence and argumentation in order to reduce aviation‚Äôs climate impact.

‚óè Developing analytical models and tools, conducting market analysis, and quantifying the impact of regulations to inform policy solutions and T&E strategy

‚óè Analyzing data as well as complex policy issues from a variety of sources including scientific studies, European Commission reports and models being used to shape EU policy

‚óè Support the organization with ad hoc requests and fast technical responses for both internal and for third party stakeholders, such as policy makers and journalists.

‚óè Advocating T&E‚Äôs position to policymakers at EU and national level, politicians, business leaders, civil society actors and our international network.

‚óè Converting large data sets or complex policy implications into clear, robust and beautiful charts.










The successful candidate would ideally meet the following criteria:




‚óè At least two years relevant experience in the field of energy and/or transport. This position is open to talented entry level candidates to those with 5+ years experience. Job title and salary will reflect previous experience.

Expertise in and knowledge of energy systems, electricity markets and synthetic fuels and their processes.

‚óè Have strong analytical skills, an ability to quickly grasp technical issues, assess data, and good knowledge of Excel. Python programming would be an advantage.

‚óè Relevant professional experience working on technical issues in the environmental or energy sectors, or in a research institution

‚óè Project management experience including strong interpersonal and team-working skills and an ability to deliver to tight deadlines.

‚óè Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to write in English fluently, accurately and concisely. Other European languages are considered a bonus

‚óè The confidence to think and act with initiative, to engage and influence policymakers of different stripes, industry representatives and other stakeholders at the highest level.







Practicalities




This position is advertised as a permanent, full-time position based in Brussels. While we offer a flexible working environment, there is an expectation that there are at least two days per week spent in the office. Candidates can also be based in cities in our nearby national offices: Paris, London, or Berlin. For candidates based in those cities, there is an expectation that they will work in the T&E offices at least two days a week, and will spend several days per month in Brussels.




The salary package depends on location and experience. We are an equal opportunities employer and offer competitive salary and benefits.

For candidates based in those cities, there is an expectation that they will work in the T&E offices at least two days a week, and will spend several days per month in Brussels.


The salary package depends on location and experience. We are an equal opportunities employer and offer competitive salary and benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?

With us, your expertise won‚Äôt just sit in dashboards ‚Äì it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You‚Äôll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact ‚Äì all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will:


translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems‚Ä¶)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios


What You Bring To The Table


5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English


Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Want to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today‚Äôs three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:


a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)


Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?

We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers ‚Äì 02 370 30 62 ‚Äì erwin.verniers@external.equans.com ‚Äì https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers

Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.


Your profile

We are looking for someone who :


Owns a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.Is eligible for security clearance.


Success in this role often comes down to :


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.


Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.


Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you‚Äôre passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative analyst

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

About S&EM:

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It‚Äôs mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the ‚ÄúPricing‚Äù team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.

Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:


Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, ‚Ä¶).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.


Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, ‚Ä¶)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Familiar with Git




Good to have:

Experience on the power markets
Experience on different optimization methods
Experience in a trading environment

Soft skills:


Must have:

Practical and conceptual thinking
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Ability to deliver concrete solutions
Autonomy
Working together

Ed ucation and professional background:


Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.


Languages:


English


Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

Professionele werkervaring: Junior (<3 jaar ervaring)

Opleidingsniveau: WO / Master opleiding

Title: Senior Data Analyst BeNe
Description:
Location: Brussels or Hoofddorp

¬†

Are you driven by data and passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences? Join our BeNe Customer Experience & Quality team as a¬†Senior Data Analyst, where your insights will shape the future of how we serve our customers.

This is a high-impact role at the heart of a major transformation, including the rollout of AI and the evolution of our Customer Contact Center. You‚Äôll be the bridge between raw data and strategic decisions, helping us improve satisfaction, streamline operations, and future-proof our services.

¬†

Key responsibilities:

Customer Insights: Analyze feedback from loyalty and transactional surveys, mapping it by persona and touchpoint to uncover opportunities across the customer journey.
Root Cause Analysis: Identify recurring themes in quality cases and complaints to drive long-term solutions and process improvements.
Operational Efficiency: Use data to optimize key metrics like FTE, workload, AHT, and quality scores, supporting smarter resource planning.
AI Readiness: Assess data maturity and support the deployment of scalable AI and agent-assist technologies.
Reporting & Dashboards: Build and maintain dashboards using Tableau, BFO, and Medallia to support leadership with consistent, time-saving insights.
Data Management: Clean, structure, and manage large datasets, developing robust data models and reporting systems.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with teams across the business, including Finance, to enhance data governance and prioritize Cost of Poor Quality (CoPQ) initiatives.

Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in customer-facing or pricing environments.
Proficiency in Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to turn data into actionable insights.
Experience managing multiple priorities and working cross-functionally.
Fluency in English plus French or Dutch.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Marketing, or a related field.
Bonus: Experience with data warehousing and ETL tools like Amazon Glue.

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

¬†

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

¬†

Title: Data Visualization Intern
Description:
About HireShire




HireShire is an innovative staffing and talent solutions platform dedicated to connecting organizations with exceptional emerging talent. As we expand into the business analytics domain, we are pleased to introduce an internship program designed for motivated, analytical individuals seeking valuable industry experience.




Role Overview




As a Data Analytics Intern at HireShire, you will support our analytics and business intelligence teams in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data to drive insights across our HR-tech ecosystem. This is an opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with real-world datasets, building dashboards, and generating reports that support decision-making in a fast-growing tech environment.




Key Responsibilities




Convert raw data into insightful and visually engaging dashboards and reports.
Assist in developing interactive dashboards using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Work closely with analysts to ensure insights are clear, accurate, and actionable.
Support the creation of data-driven stories and stakeholder presentations.
Contribute to ad-hoc visualization and reporting tasks as needed.




Requirements

Currently pursuing (or recently completed) B.Tech/BE/M.Tech/MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, IT, or related fields
Strong understanding of statistics, data wrangling, and visualization concepts
Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets and familiarity with SQL
Knowledge of Python (libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn) or R
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently in a remote setup




Nice to Have (Bonus)




Familiarity with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Exposure to machine learning basics (scikit-learn, regression, clustering, etc.)
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) for data storage/analysis
Participation in data hackathons, Kaggle competitions, or analytics clubs
Certifications like Google Data Analytics, Microsoft Data Analyst Associate, or similar




What You‚Äôll Get




Real-time exposure to data analytics projects within a tech-driven product environment
Hands-on training in EDA, data visualization, and BI dashboarding
1:1 mentorship from experienced data professionals & exclusive learning resources
Internship Certificate & Letter of Recommendation upon successful completion
Opportunity for a Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) at HireShire or with our client organizations




Hiring Process




Online Application
Analytics Aptitude Test
Technical Interview
Managerial Interview
Offer
Onboarding




Stipend




Minimum ‚Ç¨18per hour(in accordance with European Union federal & state minimum wage guidelines for interns), with potential increment based on interview scores and skill assessment.

Title: Consultant - Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Your Role




As a BI Analyst, you play a crucial role in analyzing, modeling, visualizing and optimizing data to gain strategic insights. You will work with various teams to develop robust data models, create impactful visualizations and ensure that data is accurately, consistently, and efficiently mapped and processed.




Requirements




At least 3 years of experience as a BI/Data Analyst or in a similar role
Deep expertise in Power BI, including designing and maintaining dashboards that deliver clear, actionable insights
Strong SQL and DAX skills, with experience creating efficient queries, calculations, and measures
Hands-on experience with Databricks for data transformation, preparation, and modeling to support BI solutions
Proven experience designing, maintaining, and optimizing tabular models for high-performance analytics
Knowledge of data modeling (e.g., star schemas, dimensional models) and experience applying these in BI projects
Familiarity with implementing role-based data access and security measures (RLS/OLS)
Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly convey complex insights
Strong analytical thinking and a structured approach to complex problems
Languages: Bilingual ‚Äì Fluent in Dutch & English or French & English







What You Will Do




Develop and optimize data models that support strategic decision-making
Build, enhance, and maintain Power BI dashboards that transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders
Work with large datasets in Power BI, ensuring efficient processing and responsive visualization
Streamline and enhance data transformations using best practices in tools like Power Query and DAX
Implement and manage data security measures to ensure the right users access the right information at the right time
Analyze data using statistical and analytical techniques
Contribute to organization-wide BI strategies, including guidelines and knowledge sharing
Improve current data governance and implement procedures for high-quality, trusted, and consistent data




Why Choose Exsolv√¶?




Work on impactful data projects
Collaborate with experts in an innovative and learning-driven environment
Access professional development opportunities to strengthen your skills
Hybrid work environment with a healthy balance between remote and on-site
Competitive salary package and comprehensive benefits

Title: Data Analyst-Developer
Description:
Within our department IT Front & Packages with the mission of developing and maintaining our web applications and all our third-party applications, we are seeking a Data Analyst-Developer. The person will play a central role in developing IT Data & BI solutions to reach business objectives. She/He will ensure the availability, performance, and evolution of key business applications that support operational and strategic needs. She/He will strive to maximize the use of the company‚Äôs data assets.

The team consists of 8 colleagues who are eager to welcome you!

Your responsibilities

As An Analyst-Developer, Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into technical specifications.
Designing, developing, and implementing data warehousing and BI solutions to meet business requirements.
Performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using tools such as SQL, Python, and ETL frameworks.
Developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools like Power BI.
Ensuring data integrity, quality, and security across all data platforms.
Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Supporting the business in understanding and using the available data to facilitate creation of their own reports and dashboards Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in data analytics, BI & AI.
Participating in data & BI documentation (implement and manage tools supporting the documentation and contribute to the content along with other team members).
Implementing and managing tools that will improve data security and governance.


Your profile


You hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, a related field, or possess equivalent experience.
You have proven experience as a Data Analyst, BI Developer, or similar role.
You have proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and database management.
You have experience with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
You are familiar with programming languages such as Python.
You are fluent in English and French or Dutch, with a good command of the other national language.
You can learn quickly and adapt in a dynamic environment.
You have an analytical mindset and are solution-oriented.
You are proactive and can communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
You value teamwork and can work both on-site and remotely, including with offshore developers.


Good reasons to join us


A permanent employment contract.
A company that values human scale within a dynamic group where you can make a significant impact.
Accessible management that is close to its employees and fosters a pleasant working environment.
Numerous development opportunities, particularly through our Athora Academy.
A balance between professional and private life with generous holidays (at least 39 days a year), flexible working hours, and up to 3 days of teleworking per week.
An attractive salary package with various fringe benefits.
Modern, bright offices that encourage collaboration.
A central location in the Porte de Namur district, easily accessible by train and public transport, with parking available if needed.
Last but not least‚Ä¶ a sunny terrace, after-work gatherings, team-building activities, an annual staff day, and many other events to discover‚Ä¶ üòâ


If you are looking for a friendly organization with a human touch and value collaboration and mutual support, you have come to the right place!

Title: Aviation Energy Data Analyst
Description:
IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN THIS ROLE, PLEASE APPLY VIA OUR WEBSITE FOLLOWING THIS LINK : https://jobs.transportenvironment.org/o/aviation-energy-data-analyst




Your application won't be taking into consideration if you only apply via LinkedIn, thanks.










ü´µRole: Aviation Energy Data Analyst

üìç Location: Brussels

üìÖ Application Deadline: 05/09/2025

‚úíÔ∏è Start Date: ASAP







Are you concerned by transport‚Äôs climate impact and continued reliance on fossil fuels? Have you got experience in how the electricity system will need to adapt to cope with the changes to both supply and additional demand? T&E is looking for a talented and dynamic data analyst to join the team to work on electro-sustainable aviation fuels (e-SAF). The electrification of transport and acceleration of the deployment of renewable energy will create both challenges and opportunities in the green transition. The analyst will work alongside the shipping and energy team to build a case for e-fuels to use in transport‚Äôs hard-to-abate sectors.




Aviation is a challenging sector to decarbonize. We‚Äôre looking for a data analyst to research available aviation decarbonization options, using data and research to inform policy and financial instruments in order to deliver the required fuels. We need convincing and compelling charts, analysis, reports and presentations to convert complex information into advocacy and media friendly material. Finally, we need to convince European lawmakers to set ambitious but achievable goals to drive the sector from being the fastest growing climate problem to one of sustainability.




This position requires an engineer or scientist with experience in environmental science, energy systems or related fields.







Main functions of the role:




‚óè Taking a leading role on T&E‚Äôs analytical work on green energy for aviation

‚óè Compiling robust and compelling data, evidence and argumentation in order to reduce aviation‚Äôs climate impact.

‚óè Developing analytical models and tools, conducting market analysis, and quantifying the impact of regulations to inform policy solutions and T&E strategy

‚óè Analyzing data as well as complex policy issues from a variety of sources including scientific studies, European Commission reports and models being used to shape EU policy

‚óè Support the organization with ad hoc requests and fast technical responses for both internal and for third party stakeholders, such as policy makers and journalists.

‚óè Advocating T&E‚Äôs position to policymakers at EU and national level, politicians, business leaders, civil society actors and our international network.

‚óè Converting large data sets or complex policy implications into clear, robust and beautiful charts.










The successful candidate would ideally meet the following criteria:




‚óè At least two years relevant experience in the field of energy and/or transport. This position is open to talented entry level candidates to those with 5+ years experience. Job title and salary will reflect previous experience.

Expertise in and knowledge of energy systems, electricity markets and synthetic fuels and their processes.

‚óè Have strong analytical skills, an ability to quickly grasp technical issues, assess data, and good knowledge of Excel. Python programming would be an advantage.

‚óè Relevant professional experience working on technical issues in the environmental or energy sectors, or in a research institution

‚óè Project management experience including strong interpersonal and team-working skills and an ability to deliver to tight deadlines.

‚óè Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to write in English fluently, accurately and concisely. Other European languages are considered a bonus

‚óè The confidence to think and act with initiative, to engage and influence policymakers of different stripes, industry representatives and other stakeholders at the highest level.







Practicalities




This position is advertised as a permanent, full-time position based in Brussels. While we offer a flexible working environment, there is an expectation that there are at least two days per week spent in the office. Candidates can also be based in cities in our nearby national offices: Paris, London, or Berlin. For candidates based in those cities, there is an expectation that they will work in the T&E offices at least two days a week, and will spend several days per month in Brussels.




The salary package depends on location and experience. We are an equal opportunities employer and offer competitive salary and benefits.

Title: Temporary staff (NATO HQ)
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

31-Aug-2026, 5:59:00 PM

Grade

TEMP

NATO is looking for applicants to fill temporary positions that arise occasionally at NATO Headquarters, Brussels, Belgium.

Are you a national of a NATO member state, with skills in a relevant discipline, and proficiency in English or French (preferably with a good knowledge of the other language)?

Do you have experience in political affairs, public diplomacy, project management, finance, IT, Cyber, legal affairs, translation, HR or administrative support?

Then this might be an opportunity for you!

In view of the nature and of the urgency of the temporary positions we are looking to fill, it is important for candidates to be available for temporary employment on short notice. In practice, this implies either being in possession of valid NATO security clearance at the time of application, or having been in possession of such a clearance with the possibility to reactivate it swiftly. We therefore only encourage applications for temporary positions if you are already, or have previously been, in possession of a valid NATO security clearance.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:



You will have experience in one of the following areas:


Administrative Support
Legal Affairs
Finance (budgeting, accounting); Audit
Procurement & Purchasing
Logistics (supply chain, warehouse & stock management); Infrastructure and facilities management
Information Knowledge Management (Data entry/encoding, document management/registry/archives)
Event & conference management
Project and Programme Management
Engineering
Information Technology (Software, Hardware, Web Programming)
Human Resources (recruitment, staff services, organisational development)
Cyber defence / security
Public Diplomacy (Press and Media, Journalism, Communications); Graphic Design and Printing; Web Design, online editing, social media management
Linguistic services
Defence (Defence Planning, Defence Investment)
Natural sciences (research and analysis)
Political affairs (drafting policy, diplomacy, public administration)
COMPETENCIES:



You will demonstrate:


Clarity and Accuracy (Checks own work);
Customer Service Orientation (Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems);
Empathy (Listens actively);
Flexibility (Acts with flexibility);
Initiative (Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation);
Organizational Awareness (Understands the Organization's structure);
Teamwork (Expresses positive attitudes and expectations of team or team members).
RECRUITMENT PROCESS



When submitting your application, please note that you are applying to a candidate pool, and not for a particular assignment. You will receive an acknowledgement of receipt from the system of your application.

It is a condition of employment that before a temporary staff member can be appointed, the Organization must have received a security clearance certificate (minimum NATO Secret) from the government of the country or countries of which he/she is a national.

Important:

Note that this process is only to be included in our temporary database, and does not constitute a guarantee of employment.

Please attach an updated CV and relevant certifications to your application.

You are responsible for keeping your information up-to-date by making the appropriate changes (e.g. availability, clearance, etc.) directly in your Taleo application, if and when required! Please do not re-apply if changes occur, but edit your application at any time.

Any questions on this subject should be sent to recruitment@hq.nato.int.


WHAT WE OFFER:
38 hours per week schedule;
2.5 paid days of leave per month;
Fulfilling working atmosphere in an international community;
Contract: in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Regulations, temporary staff may not be employed more than 6 months for the same assignment. However, if later required, contracts may be extended for another period of up to six months
Salary: the remuneration of temporary personnel will be specified in their contracts. It is not exempt from taxation [1] . Temporary personnel are responsible for acquitting themselves of their responsibilities for the payment of taxes.
Benefits package: temporary staff are covered by a benefits package which consists of pension contributions by the Organization (12% of basic salary), medical and accident benefits (death and invalidity) provided under the NATO Group insurance contract, and paid leave of 2.5 days per month worked. For staff eligible under NATO rules, there is also a dependent child allowance and coverage for dependent children for medical benefits;



You will find useful information on our conditions of employment at NATO and other practical details on our website: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/86784.htm


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:



NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply.

Building Integrity is a key element of NATO‚Äôs core tasks. NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defense and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work.

Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels is a non-smoking environment.

[1] Subject to bilateral agreements entered into between the NATO body and the Host Country concerned.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Teddy, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client‚Äôs request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting‚Ä¶ could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Technical Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Technical Analyst to support the ongoing development and maintenance of the CWM (Client Wealth Management) platform. This role is essential for driving technical evolution, resolving performance issues, and ensuring seamless communication between frontend and backend systems.

You will work closely with development teams and external partners to define technical requirements, guide implementation, and support testing activities. Conduct technical analyses for new features and platform improvements. Document clear and actionable instructions for development teams. Investigate and resolve performance issues and communication gaps between frontend and backend.

Support the development of new features, including replacing outdated modules (e.g., digital signing within investment flows). Perform unit testing and validate data flows using tools like Postman and SQL.

Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to ensure alignment and smooth delivery.

Monitor and support daily operations of the CWM platform, including bug tracking and issue resolution. Participate in planning and roadmap creation for upcoming technical initiatives.

Requirements

The technical analyst must have experience with the following technologies - Java, Angular, SQL

very important: webservices (YAML, WSDL...)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?

With us, your expertise won‚Äôt just sit in dashboards ‚Äì it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You‚Äôll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact ‚Äì all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will:


translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems‚Ä¶)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios


What You Bring To The Table


5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English


Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Want to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today‚Äôs three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:


a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)


Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?

We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers ‚Äì 02 370 30 62 ‚Äì erwin.verniers@external.equans.com ‚Äì https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Functional Data Analyst Consultant




Permanent contract




FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You‚Äôll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.







Check out some of our ongoing projects:

Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.

If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let‚Äôs meet up if they match your profile!







Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:

Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Turning Data Management into practice.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.







Who you are:

Your interest & soft skills

A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Autonomous and solutions oriented.
Dynamic team player.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English.




Your technical experience

At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.
Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Proficient reporting and documentation skills.
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.










Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular ‚ÄúGuild‚Äù workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities.
We may work with tomorrow‚Äôs technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification.
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid ways of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels.
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances‚Ä¶
Read more about the benefits we offer here.




Apply now

We can't wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!




We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.




Your job responsibilities:




Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.
Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.
Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.




Your Requirements:




Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client‚Äôs needs.




You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.




Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.




We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.




Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!




Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

Title: Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department)
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Business Intelligence Developer (SNS02423)
Description:
Job Description


Connectivity and infrastructure
Configuration of the 2 Data Gateways (Acc and Prod), necessary for exchanges between on-premise source systems (IBM DB2, IBM UDB, MS SQL Srv, Denodo, files) and the Microsoft Fabric/Power BI platform.
Connectivity validation and technical troubleshooting support.
The goal is to provide a robust technical foundation to fully leverage Microsoft Fabric and Power BI, while ensuring the security, maintainability, and scalability of the solution.
Technical Configuration and Security
Setting up roles, logins, and security templates on Microsoft Fabric.
Set up and administer Power BI and Fabric security groups.
Definition of access policies and good governance practices.
Setting up working
environments Creating and configuring the Development, Acceptance, and Production environments for Microsoft Fabric and Power BI.
Implementation of a release management process: deployment pipeline, version control, evolution management.
Define and implement ETL types and Proofs of Concept (POC)
Design and implementation of integration flows for different scenarios:
CSV ‚Üí Data Factory ‚Üí DB2 LUW ‚Üí Power BI
CSV ‚Üí Data Factory ‚Üí Azure SQL Database ‚Üí Power BI
CSV ‚Üí Data Factory ‚Üí Lakehouse (Parquet files) ‚Üí Power BI
Denodo ‚Üí Power BI
DB2 UDB ‚Üí Power BI
CSV ‚Üí Data Factory ‚Üí OneLake ‚Üí Lakehouse ‚Üí Power BI
XML ‚Üí Data Factory ‚Üí OneLake ‚Üí Lakehouse ‚Üí Power BI
Performance testing and documentation of points of attention (file formats, latency, volume, execution costs).


Skills


ETL & Data Engineering (conception, optimisation, industrialisation)
Environment Management (Dev/Acc/Prod) & Release Management
Microsoft Fabric (Data Factory, Data Gen2, Lakehouse, OneLake, Gateways)
Microsoft Power BI (administration, s√©curit√©, gateways)
Data security and governance (roles, groups, access)

  • Setting up working

  • Define and implement ETL types and Proofs of Concept (POC)
  • Design and implementation of integration flows for different scenarios:
  • CSV ‚Üí Data Factory ‚Üí DB2 LUW ‚Üí Power BI

Skills

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for an¬†Business Analyst¬†to join our UniQue team.

What will you be doing in this role?

Analyze, evaluate, and document business processes.
Gather, analyze, and document business requirements from stakeholders.
Collect and analyze business data to support decision-making.
Assist in developing Business Cases, Project Charters, Security Plans, and risk analyses.
Collaborate with business analysts, customers, users, project leaders, and developers.
Prepare for business meetings, including notes and follow-ups.
Write and update test plans, and test team developments to ensure requirements match deliverables.




Requirements



What do you need to succeed in this position?

Master's degree with minimum of 11 years of relevant experience (or Bachelor's degree with minimum of 13 years of relevant experience), including at least 5 years of relevant Business Analyst professional experience.
At least 2 years of experience with BPMN, ARIS Architect or another modeller.
At least 2 years of experience with UML.
At least 2 years of experience with Visio and Jira.
At least 1 year documenting business requirements - software features using user stories.
Minimum 1 year of experience in analysis/modelling tools and techniques (use case diagram, state diagram, entity relationship model, interaction diagrams etc.).
Good knowledge of Agile methodology (special mention to defining user stories).
Knowledge of SQL.
Ability to perform UAT testing.



At Uni Systems, we are providing equal employment opportunities and banning any form of discrimination on grounds of gender, religion, race, color, nationality, disability, social class, political beliefs, age, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristics. Take a look at¬†¬†or more information.
