Title: Merchandising Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler¬Æ, Lee¬Æ and Rock & Republic¬Æ, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Job Posting

Merchandising Data Analyst

Location: Geneva // Switzerland

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler¬Æ and Lee¬Æ. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

What‚Äôs the scope?

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.

Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst


Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.


Skills For Success


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 3‚Äì5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal; additional European languages are a plus.
Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and a sharp eye for detail.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate insights clearly and effectively.


We Offer

We value trust, transparency, collaboration, and innovation, and focus on sustainability and teamwork. Our purpose, mission, and values guide us towards continuous growth and leveraging cutting-edge sustainable technologies.

Benefits And Perks Include


Competitive salary package
Discounts on Wrangler¬Æ & Lee¬Æ brands
Casual denim dress code at work and beyond
A multicultural, diverse, and inclusive workforce with employees from various nationalities
Employee resource groups focused on diversity, sustainability, wellbeing, and social activities
Opportunities for professional development and career growth
Advantages of being part of a global company


Why Kontoor Brands?

At Kontoor, we offer a comprehensive benefit package to fit your lifestyle. Our benefits are crafted with the same care as our products.

When our employees are healthy, secure, and well, they bring their best selves to work. Kontoor Brands supports you with a competitive benefits program that provides choice and flexibility to meet your and your family‚Äôs needs ‚Äì now and in the future. We offer resources to support your physical, emotional, social, and financial wellbeing, plus benefits like discounts on our apparel. Kontoor Brands also provides four weeks of Paid Parental Leave to eligible employees who are new parents, Flexible Fridays, and Tuition Reimbursement.

We are proud to offer a workplace culture centered on equitable opportunities and a sense of belonging for all team members. Here we have a global workforce of high-performing teams that both unlocks our individual uniqueness and harnesses our collaborative talents.

Title: Commercial Data & Analytics Intern
Description:
At Bavarian Nordic, we are committed to saving and improving lives by unlocking the power of the immune system. Our commercial product portfolio includes market-leading vaccines against smallpox, mpox, rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, typhoid fever, and cholera. We excel in R&D innovation, manufacturing, and commercialization, striving to improve people's health and quality of life worldwide, protecting our tomorrow. Join us in our mission to make a difference.

As part of our growth journey, we are looking to strengthen the Commercial Operations Team with a full-time Commercial Data & Analytics Intern. The position can be located in either Denmark, Switzerland, or Germany. The role will work in collaboration with the commercial teams to support data analysis and produce and maintain dashboards to track KPIs.

Join our team and let's make a difference together.

Key responsibilities:


Analyze field force and sales performance data to uncover actionable insights
Build, maintain, and enhance Power BI dashboards to improve reporting and transparency
Track SF performance KPIs to support sales managers' activities and improve sales execution
Ensure data consistency and data quality by performing checks and validations
Support the Data & Analytics team with ad hoc analysis and reporting tasks
Respond to data and analysis requests from commercial stakeholders across departments


Qualifications, preferred skills, and experience:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree/completion of a Master¬¥s degree in Statistics, Business, Econometrics, Data Analytics, or a related field
Proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling and DAX, and Excel
Comfortable working with large datasets and complex data structures
Familiarity with CRM systems and marketing automation tools is a big plus
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset
Relevant previous experience is a strong plus


The position is for a min. of 6 months.

We offer the opportunity to work in an international company with unique technology and a dedicated workforce. We welcome people who share our passion with a willingness to make a difference. We offer a dynamic and flexible work environment and an opportunity to develop your personal and academic competencies.

Caught your interest?

If you are ready to take on a pivotal role in a growing organization and drive meaningful change in healthcare, apply now and join Bavarian Nordic in our mission to improve health outcomes and foster sustainable growth.

Founded in 1994, we have +30 years of experience developing life-saving vaccines. We are a global leader in smallpox and mpox vaccines. Our commercial product portfolio contains market-leading vaccines against rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, cholera, typhoid, and Ebola. We are headquartered in Denmark and have manufacturing, research, and sales offices across Europe and North America. Our values ‚Äì our Bavarian Nordic DNA, as we like to call it ‚Äì are what guide our actions every day. We act as persistent pioneers, embrace change, value being boosted by the team, and believe in protecting lives every day. If that is also a part of your DNA, we invite you to join us in Bavarian Nordic! Bavarian Nordic is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

www.bavarian-nordic.com

Title: Neuroscientific Data Analysis Internship (Python)
Description:
At MaxWell Biosystems, we develop advanced instrumentation for neuroscience and life sciences applications. Our instruments consist of custom-designed CMOS-based sensor devices, a data acquisition system with FPGAs and our software suite MaxLab Live. As we expand our analytical capabilities, we are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Neuroscientific Data Analysis Intern. You will work closely with our software development teams to assist in the development, validation, and refinement of analysis pipelines for complex biological data. This is a hands-on role where programming skills, analytical thinking, and scientific curiosity will directly contribute to ensuring the accuracy and reliability of research outcomes.

¬†

Your Responsibilities

Support the development and optimization of analysis workflows for large-scale biological datasets.
Perform systematic quality control on processed data to ensure accuracy, reproducibility, and compliance with internal standards.
Collaborate with scientists and engineers to troubleshoot analysis steps and improve pipeline robustness.
Document analysis procedures and quality control findings clearly and systematically.
Contribute to internal discussions on methods improvement and data interpretation.




Your Profile

Currently pursuing or recently completed a Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, neuroscience, biotechnology, or a related field.
Experience with data analysis in Python.
Understanding of electrophysiological data or other biological signal acquisition methods.
Strong problem-solving skills and capacity to work independently as well as collaboratively.
Good communication skills in English (spoken and written).
Eagerness to learn new analysis techniques and adapt to evolving research needs.




Are you motivated to work at the intersection of science, event organization, and operations? Do you want to gain hands-on experience in supporting world-class events that drive innovation in neuroscience and drug discovery?

Join MaxWell Biosystems and contribute to advancing science and improving human health. You‚Äôll work in an international, multidisciplinary environment, collaborating with passionate experts who value curiosity,

ownership, and impact.




Philipp Hornauer looks forward to receiving your application documents by email at hr@mxwbio.com (cover letter, CV).

Sollten Sie Fragen oder Schwierigkeiten bei der Bewerbung haben, wenden Sie sich bitte an Nur Ergiydiren unter der n.ergiydiren@proclinical.com.

Proclinical ist eine spezialisierte Personalberatung, die berufliche Chancen in der pharmazeutischen, biopharmazeutischen, biotechnologischen und medizintechnischen Branche anbietet.

Proclinical Staffing ist au√üerdem ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit.

Title: Intern in Data Analysis within Process Development (100%)
Description:
Get to know Climeworks

Climeworks is a leading high-quality carbon removal provider, combining decades of expertise in Direct Air Capture (DAC) technology with a holistic approach to carbon removal solutions.

Climeworks advises companies on their carbon removal strategies and provides tailored portfolios of nature-based and engineered approaches, offering end-to-end services to help achieve net-zero goals. The company runs the world's first two DAC plants in Iceland, demonstrating its core commitment to high-quality carbon removal that is backed by over 15 years of pioneering research, development, and deployment.

By advancing the most reliable solutions in the market, Climeworks accelerates the global transition to net zero, unlocking economic value for businesses, governments, and society.

We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the world‚Äôs greatest challenge.

Will you join us?

Job description


Process development support: You actively support the Process Development team in tasks related to testing facilities, operational plants, and future projects.
Data analysis and visualization: You develop tools and visualizations to analyze the performance of testing facilities and operational plants.
Field testing and modeling: You participate in field tests, aggregate collected data, and use it to improve our modeling capabilities.
KPI development: You support the definition, implementation, and documentation of KPIs for testing and operational facilities.
Anomaly detection: You contribute to setting up anomaly detection and alerting systems for testing facilities and operational plants.


Your Story
Job requirements


Educational background: You hold or are pursuing a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
Technical skills: You bring experience with Python and SQL, with additional MATLAB skills as a plus.
Learning mindset: You are eager to learn new concepts, skills, and tools needed to complete assignments.
Work style: You are reliable, performance-driven, and structured, thriving both independently and in fast-paced team environments.
Language and availability: You are fluent in English (German is an advantage) and available for a full-time 6-month internship starting in March/April 2025.


Our promise: At Climeworks, you are accepted for who you are, and we are committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply ‚Äì regardless of background, identity, or experience. Studies show that women and individuals from minority backgrounds often only apply for jobs when they meet 100% of the listed criteria. If this sounds like you, don‚Äôt hold back. If you think you‚Äôd make a great fit for this role, we‚Äôd love to hear from you, even if you don‚Äôt check every single box. Let‚Äôs tackle one of humankind‚Äôs greatest challenges together.

What We Offer

At Climeworks, our six-month internships offer a hybrid work setup, giving you flexibility while ensuring valuable collaboration by working onsite at least three days per week. To maintain fairness, we follow a standardized salary process based on market benchmarks. For our internships based in Switzerland, the compensation is:


During BSc & MSc: CHF 2,000 per month
After completion of MSc: CHF 2,500 per month


Note: We do not accept candidate profiles through recruitment agencies.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
We are looking for a Data Modeler to join our client, a leading financial institution in Zurich.




This is a contracting role with the initial duration until the end of 2026.




Key Responsibilities:

Capture and model data requirements, including data definitions, business rules, data quality standards, and logical data models.
Conduct impact assessments for application re-wiring by analyzing and mapping as-is vs. to-be data entities.
Design logical and physical data models following best practices to ensure high data quality and reduce redundancy.
Collaborate closely with the Chief Data Office and business stakeholders to map data entities to the Enterprise Data Catalog.
Work with development teams to implement data strategies, build data flows, and support the development of conceptual data models.




Required Skills & Experience:

Strong expertise in data-driven and integrated reference architectures, with solid knowledge of banking data products, financial data classification, and metadata management tools.
Experienced in agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, SAFe), data modeling standards and tools, and certified through relevant trainings.
Excellent business stakeholder management, cross-functional collaboration between IT and business, and the ability to navigate challenges under pressure with strong interpersonal skills.




Required languages:

English and German




If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across the company. As part of our central data team, you will collaborate closely with analysts from various Business Units and our data engineering team to ensure we have the highest quality data. Your analytical insights will directly influence the direction of our tools and key company objectives.

If you thrive on breaking down complexity into actionable tasks using data, are excited about working on innovative and fast-evolving ideas, and are passionate about leveraging data to protect and enhance privacy for millions of users worldwide, we would love to hear from you!

What You Will Do



Design and visualise new KPIs capturing product success and actionable insights able to uncover new opportunities.
Monitor and Synthesize KPIs to create reports capturing key company and cross-product level insights, challenging the status quo.
Translate company-level goals into analytical tasks to ensure a data-driven approach.
Collaborate closely with engineering teams to increase the quality and usability of our data within a privacy-first ecosystem.
Mentor junior team members on statistical techniques and exploratory data analysis to achieve the right balance of analytical proficiency and business impact.
Maintain and improve our A/B testing framework within our privacy-first in-house tool used by all data analysts to evaluate and document A/B tests.
Empower stakeholders to make data-driven decisions by developing training sessions on how to use and extract insights from our dashboards.



Job Requirements



Minimum 6 years' work experience as a Data Analyst with focus on statistics, data exploration and visualisation.
Solid statistical background and experience in conducting hypothesis testing, A/B analysis and exploratory analysis.
Ability to work large business concepts into actionable analytical tasks, including handling uncertainty and open-ended problems.
Excellent knowledge of SQL and at least one programming language, preferably Python.
Proven track record of prioritizing effectively and working independently in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
Great communication skills, with the ability to adapt to both technical and non-technical audiences to achieve results.



Bonus points for:



Previous experience mentoring team members.
Hands on experience with Metabase, Clickhouse, Git and Spark.
Previous experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) products and data privacy applications



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: (Junior) Consultant
Description:
Du bist ein Young Professional und suchst eine Herausforderung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Marktforschung und Unternehmensberatung als:




(Junior) Consultant




Pensum: 100 Prozent Stellenantritt: nach Vereinbarung


Aufgaben



Betreuung von Forschungs- und Beratungsmandaten √ºber alle Phasen des Projekt-managements


Durchf√ºhrung von Workshops


Erstellen von Kunden- und Marktanalysen


Teilnahme bei Kundenmeetings


Unterst√ºtzung bei der Kundengewinnung



Qualifikation



Masterabschluss in Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften

(Universit√§t oder Fachhochschule)


Zahlenaffin und Kompetenzen in empirischen Methoden sowie R-/R-Stuio-Kenntnisse


Sicheres Auftreten und gute kommunikative F√§higkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch


Hohes Engagement, belastbar und effiziente Arbeitsweise


Erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Marktforschung, Beratung oder Marketing von Vorteil



Benefits



Professionelles Consulting-Umfeld auf anspruchsvollem, internationalem Niveau mit namhaften Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Wirtschaftsbranchen


Kleines, dynamisches Team im Z√ºrcher Technopark ‚Äì vernetzt mit Spezialist:innen in der DACH-Region


Selbstst√§ndige und flexible Arbeitseinteilung mit M√∂glichkeit von Home Office

Title: Cat Data and Tools Analyst - temporary contract 6-9 months
Description:
PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it‚Äôs like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.




Job Description

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).

The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.

This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team on a project in collaboration with PartnerRe‚Äôs Capital Management team focusing on automating data processing and enhancing reporting and analytics capabilities.

In more detail your main tasks are to:

Migrate the financial model cashflow engine from Excel to R
Design and implement an appropriate database structure for storing inputs and outputs
Develop dashboard to support structuring and portfolio reporting
Automate the production of existing reports
Establish and manage the solution documentation

The role will be based in Zurich.




Qualifications

You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.

The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:

Master degree in computer science, data engineering, or a related quantitative field
Strong programming skills in R or Python
Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
Experience with databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals
Proficient (written and verbal) in English

You are either an EU or Swiss citizen, or entitled to work in Switzerland.




Additional Information

We can offer you the opportunity to work on applying your programming skills in applied projects. You will work in an international environment, where you can learn from Senior Experts, and get insights into the reinsurance business.

One of PartnerRe‚Äôs core strengths is its technical know-how, built over many years of investment in the right people working on the challenges of quantifying and managing cat risk. Be that person and join us!




PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

Thank you,

PartnerRe Hiring Team

Title: Palantir Specialist
Description:
ALTEN Group

Within 30 years, ALTEN has become leader in both outsourced Engineering and IT Enterprise Services. ALTEN, composed of 54,000 employees (88% engineers), carries out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of 6,500 clients, the most prestigious companies in all sectors of industry, services and telecommunications. We work with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defense & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.




ALTEN Switzerland

Since 2005, with 450 current employees, ALTEN Switzerland is a reference partner in providing Engineering services to 100 world leading companies. ALTEN Switzerland‚Äôs activities cover all the main strategical areas of the Swiss market in Life Sciences, Engineering & IT Services.




____________




Join ALTEN Switzerland as a Palantir Specialist and take on the challenge of designing, configuring and managing advanced data solutions using Palantir Foundry for a key client in the financial sector.




Key Responsibilities

Configure and maintain Palantir platforms to meet evolving business needs;
Develop custom data models, dashboards and workflows for advanced analytics;
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate requirements into effective solutions;
Train and support end-users to maximize platform adoption and value.




Your profile

Hands-on experience with Palantir Foundry;
Strong skills in data engineering and data analysis;
Familiarity with AI and machine learning is preferred;
Fluent English is required; German language skills are a plus;
Background in engineering, computer science or related fields is preferred.




Location: Canton of Zurich (on-site with hybrid flexibility).




What we offer you

At ALTEN, you benefit from a permanent contract, access to cutting-edge projects with top-tier clients and opportunities for both national and international growth. We support your development with certified trainings in technical and soft skills.




Apply now and grow with us ‚Äì we believe in building the future together!




___

ALTEN Switzerland AG

8005 Z√ºrich

Tel. +41 (0) 79 103 45 63

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Internship Digital Chemistry Bayesian optimisation
Description:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all ‚Äì while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Job Description

Join our Data Manufacturing Excellence and Chemistry Research teams as a Data Analytics Intern. We offer two internships: one optimizing global production processes for cost and sustainability, and another enhancing chemical target selection in research.

Both projects use cutting-edge Bayesian statistical modeling techniques to improve decision-making. You'll develop predictive models to boost manufacturing efficiency and candidate selection accuracy.

This opportunity provides exposure to real-life data from research and production, involves high-impact projects on operational efficiency and sustainability, and offers insight into a large organization's research and manufacturing operations.

Ideal for those passionate about data analysis, data science, and development.

Planned duration of the internship: 4-6 months, start date will be negotiated later (flexible)

Main Responsibilities


Work with Research and Production departments
Develop a methodology to optimize cost, sustainability impact and chemical yield
Work on a concrete case study, on one of our Active Ingredient currently on market
Identify key drivers of chemical process to be optimized
Analyze variable production cost data from 5 international manufacturing sites based in UK, Switzerland, France, USA & Brazil
Develop predictive models to anticipate cost variations
Build predictive models in R or Python (eg using PyMC and SciPy optimize packages for Bayesian inference)
Create and maintain data flows and interactive dashboards to visualize variable product cost KPIs
Participate in the development of decision support tools for cost optimization
Collaborate with international teams to standardize data collection and analysis practices
Make larger analysis on other sites including 5 sites in UK, Switzerland, France, USA & Brazil


Qualifications


BAC+5 student, Master's or Engineering School, specialized in Data Science, you are looking for a 6-month end-of-year internship.
You have knowledge of programming languages, Python, SQL
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and statistical analysis
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and statistical methods is required
Rigorous and organized, you respect quality/deadline constraints and know how to adapt your work organization according to the priorities given.
Good communicator and naturally curious, you easily discuss the progress of your activities, the problems encountered and work in a spirit of continuous service improvement.
Your interpersonal skills allow you to integrate easily into teams.
Given the company's international environment, an intermediate level of written/read English (email exchanges, meetings, technical documents...) is required at minimum.
Valid driver's license required for site access.


Additional Information

What we offer


An international experience in a multicultural environment
Exposure to concrete large-scale cost optimization projects
Possibility to publish on methodologies utilized while keeping confidential information on Syngenta knowledge
Mentoring by data experts
Opportunity to travel to different production sites


Interested? We are looking for your application! Along with your Cover letter and CV please provide a Research Summary of 2-5 pages.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Health Promotion Switzerland recognizes Syngenta's commitment to the health and well-being of its employees and awards the "Friendly Work Space" label to all its Swiss sites. At Syngenta, employee health and well-being are key to the company.

Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


Equal Opportunity

Data Engineer

Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!







So schaffst du Mehrwert

M√∂chtest du Teil eines interdisziplin√§ren Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung √ºbernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und erm√∂glichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.




Deine Hauptaufgaben:

Du bist f√ºr das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zust√§ndig.
Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
Du verantwortest die technische Qualit√§t, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien f√ºr Datenpipelines und -modelle.
Du bist zust√§ndig f√ºr das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und L√∂sungsans√§tzen.

Du schulst und bef√§higst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten L√∂sungen.
Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.




Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische F√§higkeiten, Probleml√∂sungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe

Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Franz√∂sisch von Vorteil

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data Center Operations Analyst (Geneva)
Description:
Company Description

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today ‚Äî ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500¬Æ. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

Job Description

Data Center Operations Team manages the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center. Oversees systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships. Responsible for capacity planning and continual assessments for process improvement to ensure that processes are well-documented, sustainable, and scalable. Monitors ongoing practices to ensure consistency with policies, compliance regulations and control requirements. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Roles can have an internal or external client focus. May involve company-hosted, Web-enabled solutions or may include project-based jobs in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.

This role is primarily based at our data centre facility in Geneva.

What You Get To Do In This Role


Prioritize and assign trouble tickets to data center engineers.
Manage the performance of data center operations with varying skills across Switzerland location.
Ensure effective and efficient management of day-to-day data center operations including queue management, 7/24 shift arrangement and hardware logistics.
Subject matter expert across all aspects in data center operations especially in DCIM integrations.
Ensure all operational KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and metrics are being measured and met.
Responsible for reporting key metrics to peer teams.
Inspire and guide improvement in team process, technology innovation and automation.
Manage Large Scale Events, Incident management - responsible for communications to executive stakeholders.
Manage and build workflows for data centers operations.
Has a solid understanding of all critical Mechanical & Electrical infrastructure.
Recommend, document, and oversee policies and procedures to meet industry best practices and to meet required SLAs (Service Level Agreement).
Maintain the on-call schedule coordinating absence and vacations.
Be passionate about the quality and quantity of services being provided, and continuously strive to improve our Customer Experience.


Qualifications

To be successful in this role you have:


4+ years of experience in data center operations management
Experience of managing the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center.
Holistic experience of overseeing systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships.
Experience of capacity planning and continual assessments for DC.
Good knowledge of data center facilities and infrastructure including power, HVAC, structured cabling, rack management and security.
Experience managing vendors in a data center environment.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task several unrelated issues.
General documentation skills with particular emphasis on technical processes and standards.
Knowledge and experience in ITIL process methodologies a plus.
Proven ability to function in ambiguous situations with a record of success.
Excellent communication, customer focus, problem solving, conflict management, time management and interpersonal skills required.
A deep passion for Sustainability and compliance to support our customers global impact responsibilities .
Some travel would be required--domestically and internationally.


Although data center experience is key, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and positive with a passion for developing new skills.

What You Can Expect From Us

At ServiceNow, we make work better for everyone ‚Äì including our own employees. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible for our employees. Win as a Team is part of our culture, and we aspire to wow our customers. We stay hungry and humble and focus on creating belonging. Sustainability, inclusivity, and diversity are key focus areas within our business framework so that we have transparency, equity, and accountability to deliver meaningful, measurable change. With our vision and dedication for a better future already underway. Join us on this journey!

Benefits

In addition to a competitive salary, supportive teams, and a real opportunity to progress in your career with a forward-thinking organisation, we provide resources to help you and your loved ones be well. From benefits plans and programs, to mental health resources that offer coaching and 24/7 support, to family support resources and parental leave programs ‚Äì we want to help you take care of yourself and your loved ones. Below is a glimpse into even more of our offerings or click here for a full list:


Along with holidays, we have company-wide designated global well-being days where everyone is off and can spend time doing what matters most.
Good working culture to support the balance you need in both work and life.
Parental leave programs.
Childcare and caregiving benefits.
A learning experience platform built using our own technology, to support your learning and development goals as well as a tuition reimbursement program.
A global, cross-functional mentoring program.
We also have team building activities, various employee belonging groups, volunteering, and community outreach programs.

Additional Information

Work Personas

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

Equal Opportunity Employer

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

Accommodations

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

Export Control Regulations

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

Title: Data Engineer Intern
Description:
Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:


EU / EEA citizenship
Must be graduating within or after November 2025


These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let‚Äôs talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:


Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.


What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?


Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.


Competences Required:


Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.


A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.

We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:


The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.


What‚Äôs In It For You

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential‚Äîfueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people‚Äîyou can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:


Participate in dedicated skill-building workshops
Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership


In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:


A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands


Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

ARE YOU IN? Apply now ‚Äì early application increases your chances!

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Z√ºrich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months


Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines


Month 3-4


Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.


Month 5-onwards


Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.


Qualifications


A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes
Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.


Additional Information


This position offers Hybrid working conditions and is subject to change at any time.
Candidate is required to work in the Z√ºrich office 4 days per week with 1 day being remote.
This position does not offer Visa Sponsorship opportunities.


Friendly, personable and often surprisingly uncomplicated, that's how many of our employees describe their working relationships at Sika. We call this the Sika Spirit

We offer a fair employment package with good social benefits

We look forward to your direct online application.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Z√ºrich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months

  • Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
  • Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
  • Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
  • Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines

Month 3-4

  • Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
  • Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
  • Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.

Month 5-onwards

  • Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
  • Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
  • Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
  • Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.

Qualifications

  • A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
  • Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
  • Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
  • Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
  • Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
  • Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
  • Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes
  • Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

Additional Information

  • This position offers Hybrid working conditions and is subject to change at any time.
  • Candidate is required to work in the Z√ºrich office 4 days per week with 1 day being remote.
  • This position does not offer Visa Sponsorship opportunities.

Friendly, personable and often surprisingly uncomplicated, that's how many of our employees describe their working relationships at Sika. We call this the Sika Spirit

We offer a fair employment package with good social benefits

We look forward to your direct online application.

Title: Laboranten - (Senior) Analyst LBS oder LC-MS 100%
Description:
Aufgrund des stetigen Wachstums unseres Unternehmens und zur Verst√§rkung unseres bioanalytischen Labors in Fehraltorf/Z√ºrich suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung mehrere engagierte Pers√∂nlichkeiten als

(Senior) Analyst LBS oder LC-MS 100%

Wir bieten Dir

Eine verantwortungsvolle Arbeit in einem offenen und dynamischen Team

On the job Weiterbildung und Entwicklung

Vielseitige Mitarbeit in unterschiedlichen Projekten

Moderne Infrastruktur

Work-Life-Balance: flexible Arbeitszeiten (Mo bis Fr, keine Wochenenden, keine Schicht), mind. 5 Wochen Ferien

Finanzielles: Lohngleichheit zwischen den Geschlechtern, sehr gute Sozialleistungen, Bezug von REKA-Checks

Das bringst Du mit

Chemielaborant/in, Biologielaborant/in, CTA, BTA oder MTA

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us with data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language. Experience with Data frame libraries (Polars, Pandas, Arrow, ...), and database toolkits (SQL Alchemy, ...).
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Knowledge of data engineering concepts and open-source ecosystem (Airflow, DBT, DuckDB, ...).
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Knowledge of semantic or hybrid search engines is a plus.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organizational skills. Desire to learn, explore, discover new concepts and technologies.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub


Show more

Title: Working Student in AI-Training/Model Evaluation (20%-100%)
Description:
Lightly AG is an ETH and HSG spin-off pioneering in machine learning and computer vision. Backed by Y Combinator and top-tier investors, our technology is used by global leaders in autonomous driving, medical imaging, and visual inspection.




We are looking for a working student to join our team as an AI Trainer, where your work helps improve the reliability and performance of AI systems. In this role, you‚Äôll evaluate and refine AI-Models and their output, ensuring they meet quality standards, follow instructions, and respond appropriately to different contexts.




This is a great opportunity for a driven student who wants to gain hands-on experience in AI development while making a real contribution.


Tasks


In this role, you will:





Prompt-Response Evaluation: Assess if AI responses accurately address the prompt, follow instructions, and meet quality standards.


Language & Context Check: Judge the AI‚Äôs understanding of English, including grammar, tone, and ability to handle nuance or ambiguity.


Domain Relevance: Verify that responses fit within the expected domain (e.g., technical, general knowledge, conversational).


Instruction Following: Identify when the AI deviates from the prompt or adds irrelevant information.


Optional: If tasks involve visual outputs, check image accuracy and caption clarity (depending on project needs).



Requirements


You‚Äôre a strong candidate if you:





Excellent English skills (grammar, style, comprehension).


Strong attention to detail and ability to apply guidelines consistently.


Familiarity with AI and the use of LLMs.


Background in STEM, communications, education, or similar fields is a plus but not required.


Are available for at least 20% (ideally 60%).


Possess a valid work permit for Switzerland.





üí° Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? That‚Äôs okay!




At Lightly, we believe in potential, growth, and learning. If you're excited about the role and think you could be a great fit, we encourage you to apply‚Äîeven if your experience doesn‚Äôt match the job description 100%.


Benefits



Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment.


Career growth opportunities in a growing field of AI development and machine learning.


Flexible work hours, pensums and remote work options.





Send us your CV and a short note about why this role excites you. If you‚Äôve handled similar tasks before, we‚Äôd love to hear specific examples.




We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Consulente per la protezione dei dati
Description:
Ufficio federale di polizia fedpol, 80-100%, Berna

Il contributo che pu√≤ dare


Fornire consulenza su questioni generali concernenti la protezione dei dati e su progetti e iniziative informatici
Fornire sostegno per l'integrazione dei requisiti in materia di protezione dei dati nei sistemi informatici, nello sviluppo di software e in altre soluzioni digitali
Allestire valutazioni d'impatto sulla protezione dei dati e valutazioni dei rischi nell'ambito di progetti e iniziative informatici
Elaborare pareri, direttive e promemoria su temi concernenti la protezione dei dati
Sensibilizzare sulle disposizioni in materia di protezione dei dati e sul loro impatto sui processi aziendali


Che cosa La contraddistingue


Laurea universitaria o diploma di scuola universitaria a livello di master in giurisprudenza o in una disciplina equivalente, idealmente con una pertinente formazione di base e continua nella protezione dei dati
Esperienza professionale con responsabilit√† analoga (protezione dei dati svizzera), idealmente in architetture e tecnologie informatiche, sviluppo di software ecc.
Orientamento alle soluzioni, capacit√† di trasmettere contenuti complessi in modo comprensibile (in forma orale e scritta), approccio analitico e digitale
Competenze di consulenza, assertivit√†, capacit√† organizzative e spirito d'iniziativa
Ottime conoscenze di due lingue ufficiali


fedpol in azione per la Svizzera ‚Äì sempre & ovunque

L'ambito direzionale Prevenzione della criminalit√† e diritto gestisce i centri di competenza per la compliance dei dati, il diritto, la prevenzione della criminalit√† e la lotta al riciclaggio di denaro (MROS).

La divisione Compliance dei dati presso fedpol garantisce il rispetto della protezione dei dati ed √® responsabile del sistema di gestione della compliance dei dati di fedpol per i sistemi d'informazione di polizia.

Il settore Protezione dei dati fornisce consulenza a fedpol per le questioni concernenti il diritto in materia di protezione dei dati e la compliance dei dati.

Che cosa offriamo

Lavorare per la Svizzera: Ci adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.

Vivere la diversit√†: La concretizzazione delle pari opportunit√† ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.

In forma sul posto di lavoro: Forniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.

Parit√† salariale per un lavoro di uguale valore: Garantiamo la parit√† salariale e fissiamo la retribuzione in base alle prestazioni fornite, all'esperienza maturata e ai requisiti richiesti per un determinato posto di lavoro.

Conciliare lavoro e vita privata: Sosteniamo alle nostre collaboratrici e i nostri collaboratori nel realizzare i loro progetti di vita offrendo forme di lavoro flessibili e diversi modelli di orario di lavoro.

Prospettive professionali: Grazie a un'offerta di formazione e di formazione continua sempre aggiornata, promuoviamo lo sviluppo personale e professionale delle nostre collaboratrici e dei nostri collaboratori.
