Title: ICT Data Analyst*in mit Schwerpunkt Power BI 80-100%
Description:
Z√ºrich

Informatik

80% - 100%

Zur Erweiterung unseres Teams im Fachbereich Informatik suchen wir eine*n ICT Data Analyst*in mit Schwerpunkt Power BI

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
We are looking for a Data Modeler to join our client, a leading financial institution in Zurich.




This is a contracting role with the initial duration until the end of 2026.




Key Responsibilities:

Capture and model data requirements, including data definitions, business rules, data quality standards, and logical data models.
Conduct impact assessments for application re-wiring by analyzing and mapping as-is vs. to-be data entities.
Design logical and physical data models following best practices to ensure high data quality and reduce redundancy.
Collaborate closely with the Chief Data Office and business stakeholders to map data entities to the Enterprise Data Catalog.
Work with development teams to implement data strategies, build data flows, and support the development of conceptual data models.




Required Skills & Experience:

Strong expertise in data-driven and integrated reference architectures, with solid knowledge of banking data products, financial data classification, and metadata management tools.
Experienced in agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, SAFe), data modeling standards and tools, and certified through relevant trainings.
Excellent business stakeholder management, cross-functional collaboration between IT and business, and the ability to navigate challenges under pressure with strong interpersonal skills.




Required languages:

English and German




If you are interested in this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Show more

Title: Data Historian
Description:
CLEEVEN is a European consulting group founded on two core convictions:

The excellence of European engineers must be a driver of global competitiveness
Our human mission is to support our consultants in their personal and professional development




As part of a major transformation project in the pharmaceutical industry, we are recruiting a Data Historian Engineer (Aveva PI) to strengthen our client‚Äôs industrial IT teams. The role will focus on designing, maintaining, and optimizing the Aveva PI solution to ensure reliable, compliant, and high-quality data management in validated GxP environments.




Role & Responsibilities :

Design, configure, and maintain data historian systems based on Aveva PI
Develop and optimize data models, interfaces, and tags to support production, quality, and compliance processes
Ensure seamless integration between Aveva PI, MES, SCADA, QMS, and other enterprise systems
Support validation and documentation activities in a GxP environment (CSV, audits, SOPs)
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to translate requirements into robust historian solutions
Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability and reliability
Train and support end users in leveraging historian data for reporting and analytics




Key Skills & Experience :

Proven experience with Aveva PI (OSIsoft PI System) in industrial or pharmaceutical contexts
Strong understanding of data historian data models and time-series data structures
Knowledge of integration with MES/SCADA/automation systems
Familiarity with GxP / CSV environments is a strong asset
Solid background in Windows Server, networking concepts, and industrial IT systems
Analytical mindset, ability to structure and document processes




Your Profile :

Engineering degree (IT, automation, data engineering) or equivalent experience
Fluent German (written and spoken) and professional English required
Strong communication skills with both technical teams and business users
Structured, detail-oriented, and solution-driven personality
Availability to work on-site in Switzerland (Basel area)




See you soon !

Show more

Title: Product Control Analyst
Description:
MET International AG (METI) was established in 2010 in order to consolidate and develop MET Group‚Äôs international natural gas sales and purchase portfolio, as well as to establish a trading arm for commodity lines.



METI is responsible for providing highly competitive supply structures to its gas and power sales affiliates, optimizing its power generation assets, managing the LNG portfolio, and trading around international positions.





Job Description


Production and supervision of the BAUs reporting cycle (P&L, exposures)
Daily interaction with Market Risk, Deal Validation and CFOs teams
Investigation of issues (e.g., booking, pricing) in Endur ETRM system impacting P&L and/or risk
Improve valuation methodology documents
Daily interaction with the 5 trading desks of METI, acting proactively to ensure the system or record ENDUR is up to date
Involvement in projects to enhance reporting systems and/or migrations, reconciling MTM‚Äôs and Deltas and understanding impacts of changes in methodology
Help shape and improve the PC management function and governance
Monitoring compliance with Risk management policies and any relevant operational policies which impact the P&L booking
Monitoring of breaches of Book ID and limits
Strong experience on financial and physical options, including Collar options, floor pricing, storages


Qualifications


Minimum 3+ years of experience in a Product Control, Risk, or Middle Office role within a trading environment, with a strong academic background in a related quantitative discipline, ACA/CIMA or CFA additionally advantageous
Strong understanding of valuation methodologies, P&L attribution, and reconciliation of MTM and Greeks
Proven exposure to physical optionality trading, particularly in renewable power and complex structured products (e.g., storage, collars, floor pricing); ability to understand the embedded optionality and its impact on risk/P&L
Technical experience with SQL, Power BI, VBA and Python is highly advantageous
Deep knowledge of the Endur ETRM system is advantageous or other, including deal booking, pricing, and front-to-back data flows
Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally with trading desks, Risk, CFOs, and Back Office to resolve booking or valuation issues
Hands-on experience with SQL for data extraction, reconciliation, and analysis to support reporting and investigations
Analytical, detail-oriented, and proactive, with a strong focus on governance, compliance, and process improvement initiative


Additional Information


An international environment and workforce with ca. 60 nationalities, with a commitment to respect, diversity and integrity
Career growth and development at one of Switzerland's Top Employers
Highly competitive remuneration system, above-market earning potential via our unique performance-based bonus schemes, reflecting the value we place on dedication and results
Work in a flat organizational structure with best-in-class industry experts, promoting individual ideas, rapid decision-making, and high accountability
A rapidly growing company entering new markets globally and expanding its asset portfolio worldwide, with substantial investment into green energy (renewables) assets
Benefit from international career opportunities and internal mobility within our 17 globally located offices
Engaging annual company events, from group-level teambuilding to local entity events and festive celebrations
Show more

Title: IT CRM Application Support Specialist
Description:
Job Description

General Info


Department : IT Run the bank
Work time Percentage : 100%
Location : Geneva


Our Company

EFG International is a global private banking group, offering private banking and asset management services. We serve clients in over 40 locations worldwide. EFG International offers a stimulating and dynamic work environment and strives to be an employer of choice.

EFG is committed to providing an equitable and inclusive working environment that is founded on the principle of mutual respect. Joining our team means experiencing a supportive environment, where your contributions are valued and recognised. We strongly believe that the diversity of our teams gives us a competitive advantage by fostering better decision-making and greater innovation.

Our Purpose and Mission

Empowering entrepreneurial minds to create value ‚Äì today and for the future.

We are a private bank, offering personalised solutions on a global scale to private and institutional clients. Our sustainable success is based on our talents and on how we partner with our clients and communities to create lasting value.

Job Description

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented IT Application Support Specialist to join our team, with a focus on supporting our CRM (Customer Relationship Management) system. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing technical and functional support to end-users, ensuring the CRM system runs smoothly, and assisting in troubleshooting and resolving system issues. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including sales, marketing, customer service, and external vendors to ensure optimal CRM usage.

Key Responsibilities


Provide 1st and 2nd level support for the CRM application (Banker‚Äôs Front).
Monitor system performance and user-reported issues, ensuring timely resolution and minimal disruption to business operations.
Analyze and troubleshoot technical issues, escalating complex cases to internal or external teams when necessary.
Maintain CRM user accounts, permissions, roles, and configurations.
Assist with system upgrades, patches, and new feature implementations.
Develop and maintain documentation for CRM processes, procedures, and training materials.
Support data integrity initiatives, including data cleansing, de-duplication, and validation.
Perform routine data exports, reports, and dashboards as needed by various departments.
Ensure compliance with internal IT policies and data protection regulations.


Skills and experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in application support, preferably in CRM environments.
Good knowledge of relational databases and SQL queries.
Familiarity with ITIL or service management frameworks is an asset.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication skills in English (both written and verbal).
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Skills


Experience with CRM customization and configuration.
Basic scripting or automation experience (e.g., PowerShell, Batch).
Knowledge of Windows Server and IIS Administration


Our Values


Accountability : Taking ownership for tasks and challenges, as well as seeking continuous improvement
Hands-on : Being proactive to rapidly deliver high-quality results
Passionate : Being committed and striving for excellence
Solution-driven : Focusing on client outcomes and treating clients fairly with a risk-aware mindset
Partnership-oriented : Promoting collaboration and teamwork. Working together with an entrepreneurial spirit.
Please ensure to attach a cover letter to your CV when filling the application.


Application


Should you wish to apply for this position use this link to apply.

Title: Information Technology Support Analyst
Description:
Are you a proactive and customer-focused IT professional seeking your next challenge?

Would you like to join a high-performing, global organisation that leverages the latest technologies to drive innovation and excellence?




Are you looking for a role that will support your professional growth, expand your technical skill set, and enhance your career portfolio?

If so, our Service Desk Analyst position could be an excellent opportunity for you.




THE MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Deliver best practice incident management (1st level support)
First point of contact for customer liaison and keeping customers informed of the progress of incidents
Recording, investigating, diagnosing, and resolving incidents
Communicating both proactively and reactively with all users and technical resolving teams
Ensuring the correct reassignment of unresolved or misrouted incidents
Provide proactive support in order to consistently improve the "end-user experience"




TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE:

Windows 10/MS Office 2016/2019
Active Directory Administration
Exchange Administration
Internet Explorer & Chrome
Troubleshooting PCs/Laptops/Tablets/MFDs
Remote Connectivity: Fortinet VPN/Citrix
TCP/IP Troubleshooting
Mobile Support: IOS
Market Data: Bloomberg & Reuters
Audio/Visual: Projectors/Video conferencing/TVs
Management of Anti-Virus Software
Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role




SKILLS:

Strong English, oral and written. German is a useful extra
Educated to degree level.
Accredited in ITIL, ITSM
Strong customer-facing/personal interaction skills

Title: IT Support Engineer
Description:
Locations: 4 days at Schileren and 2 day at Winthertur


Experience with Microsoft desktop operating system and Windows application deployment, configuration, and management.
Windows Client Administration.

Basic experience in supporting networks devices and servers in business environment.
Ensure that work is carried out within agreed service levels.
Explain and document technical issues in a clear way to technical teams, business stakeholders.
Have proven track record of working with technologies from Microsoft Intune (Autopilot), SCCM, VMWare Horizon, Intune etc.
Proactive and passionate of EUC, with strong interpersonal skills and excellent time management skills
Strong capabilities in Windows 10 / Windows 11 support, migration & Deployment.
If necessary, liaise with third-party support and PC equipment vendors.
Perform related duties consistent with the scope and intent of the position.
Hands on Experience End to End Desktop/Laptop life cycle management.
Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment.
Communication and Analytical skills
Provide technical support to clients on-site, resolving hardware, software, and network issues.
Install, configure, and maintain computer systems and related equipment.
Diagnose and troubleshoot technical problems using analytical and problem-solving skills.
Train and educate clients on how to use new technologies and software.
Document technical issues and solutions for future reference.
Maintain a positive and professional attitude while interacting with clients.
Stay up to date with the latest technology trends and advancements.


Technical Experience

The Tech-bar/OSS support member should have strong technical knowledge and hands‚Äìon experience on below technologies:


Microsoft Client OS (Win 10, 11)
Active Directory & it's services, DHCP, DNS
Print and File share services
Hardware Break-fix
Patch Management


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (may not be required in all cases).
Minimum 3 years of experience up to 5 years of experience, in technical support, preferably in an onsite environment.
Strong understanding of computer hardware, software, and networking concepts.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build rapport with clients.
Ability to work independently and solve problems effectively.
Excellent time management and organizational skills.
Valid driver's license and willingness to travel to client sites (preferred).
Experience with specific industry-related technologies.
Certifications in relevant technical fields (CompTIA A+, Network+, etc.).
Bilingual or multilingual skills (country specific local language skills-preferred).

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are Kaizen Gaming

Kaizen Gaming, the team powering Betano, is one of the biggest GameTech companies in the world, operating in 19 markets. We always aim to leverage cutting-edge technology, providing the best experience to our millions of customers who trust us for their entertainment.

We are a diverse team of more than 2.700 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents.

Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there‚Äôll be no average day for you. Ready to Press Play on Potential?

Let's start with the role

We are looking for an outstanding Data Analyst to join our fast-growing BI & Analytics team and contribute to the expansion of our Kaizen Gaming functions during an exciting scale-up data journey.

As a Data Analyst you will:

  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders, proactively providing data analyses and insights to the function;
  • Interpret KPIs with a clear understanding on results vs. expected targets;
  • Communicate insights and recommendations effectively to stakeholders enabling them to make better-informed business decisions;
  • Continuously assess and refine existing metrics and KPIs and work closely with the rest of Business Intelligence (BI) to develop new ones that drive business growth;
  • Work closely with the rest of BI team to ensure alignment, adopt best practices in data visualization, and facilitate seamless information flow from the hub to the spoke and vice versa;
  • Contribute to fostering a strong data-driven culture across the organization;
  • Design and develop data intelligence solutions, including analysis, reporting and dashboards of key metrics and KPIs.

What you‚Äôll bring

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Operations Research, or similar;
  • Experience in a reporting, statistical or quantitative role‚Äîexperience in the gaming industry would be considered a plus;
  • Analytical mindset and detail-oriented with ability to focus and prioritize workload;
  • Exceptional data storytelling skills and the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience;
  • Strategic thinker with the ability to collaborate and engage with senior stakeholders;
  • High drive, can-do attitude, proactive, and adaptable to changing business demands;
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL, as well as strong skills in MS-Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, v-lookups);
  • Working experience with Microsoft Power BI would be considered a plus (or other dashboarding tools such as Tableau);
  • Working experience with Python would also be considered a plus (especially Pandas, Numpy, and other relevant libraries for data analysis);
  • Fluent in English.

At Kaizen Gaming, we value innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement. If you're passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you.

Kaizen Gaming Perks

  • üïë Hybrid way of working
  • üèÉ A buddy will support you with your onboarding
  • üí∏ Competitive pay and bonus scheme
  • üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Private health insurance for you and your family
  • üí∞ Monthly meal allowance
  • ‚≠êDevelopmental 360¬∞ feedback framework
  • üìö Unlimited access to Udemy & continuous training

Recruitment Privacy Notice

Regarding the data you share with us, you may find and read our recruitment privacy notice here.

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation,or age.

Title: Internship, Data Insights (Central Operations)
Description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world‚Äôs largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We‚Äôre also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that‚Äôs built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun ‚Äì where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

This role will be based in S√£o Paulo.

At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.

Please submit your application in English.

As a Data Insights Intern in Central Operations, you‚Äôll apply what you‚Äôre learning in the classroom to real operational problems. You‚Äôll help build and maintain analytics assets, improve data quality and governance, and create lightweight automations that make our workflows faster and more reliable. You‚Äôll own portions of work end-to-end, collaborate across teams, and present your findings to stakeholders.

What you‚Äôll do:


Reporting & dashboards: support the creation, iteration, and delivery of recurring reports and dashboards that guide operational decisions.
Data quality & governance: assist with data cleaning, documentation, and compliance activities to ensure high quality, trustworthy datasets.
Workflow automation: contribute to small automations that reduce manual steps, improve SLAs, and standardize processes.
Business analysis: run ad hoc analyses to answer well scoped questions, quantify impact, and surface actionable insights for partners.
Risk & compliance support: help investigate issues by compiling data, performing checks, and summarizing findings as needed.
Communication: share progress and recommendations in team meetings and leadership forums; incorporate feedback and iterate quickly.



What you‚Äôll learn


How to turn raw data into stakeholder ready insights using BI tools.
How to design lightweight automations that remove toil and drive consistency.
How data governance practices keep analytics environments compliant and reliable.
How to communicate technical findings clearly and persuasively to nontechnical audiences.



Qualifications

Basic‚ÄâQualifications:


Enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Engineering, Math or similar courses.
Business fluency in English
Experience with Data Analysis, including advanced Excel skills and SQL skills
Available for at least 12 months of Internship



Preferred Qualifications


Experience with Power BI or Tableau for building dashboards.
Python for data wrangling/automation (e.g., pandas) is a plus.
Familiarity with issue tracking tools (e.g., Jira) and interest in process optimization.
Exposure to data catalogs/governance concepts (e.g., documentation, data quality checks).
Structured problem solving, attention to detail, and a bias for ownership on end-to-end tasks.



Suggested Skills:


Cross Function Collaboration
Problem Solving
Data Analytics‚ÄØ



Additional Information

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates

Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Planning and Control
Description:
üöÄ Ruolo: Junior Data Analyst - Planning and Control




üìç Localit√†: Roma




üïí Tipo di Contratto: Tempo Indeterminato




‚ú® Su di noi: Benvenuto/a in SIAE, la Societ√† Italiana degli Autori ed Editori! Siamo il faro per chi opera nel mondo della cultura e dello spettacolo e proteggiamo i diritti d‚Äôautore delle opere dei nostri associati e delle nostre associate, garantendo il giusto compenso per il loro talento. Unirsi a noi √® una scelta volontaria che offre una tutela economica indispensabile per chi crea.




üéØ La tua sfida: sei curioso/a di partecipare con noi e contribuire al cambiamento digitale di SIAE? Hai la passione per i progetti tecnologici e per la semplificazione dei processi?

Il candidato che stiamo cercando ha maturato almeno 2 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst in organizzazioni strutturate; avr√† una solida mentalit√† analitica, una profonda comprensione dei dati e la capacit√† di tradurre informazioni complesse e dati grezzi in insights utili per guidare le decisioni strategiche dell‚Äôazienda.

La risorsa verr√† inserita nell‚ÄôU.O. Management Accounting & Segment Reporting, all‚Äôinterno della Direzione Planning and Control e sar√† chiamato a supportare il raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali attraverso lo svolgimento delle seguenti attivit√†:




üíº Le Tue Responsabilit√†:

Analisi dati: raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati aziendali e da fonti esterne, sviluppare e implementare database per consentire l‚Äôanalisi delle performance aziendali e la definizione di obiettivi.
Pianificazione: collaborare con il team per sviluppare piani strategici e operativi basati sull'analisi dei dati, supportando le attivit√† di budgeting, forecasting e simulazioni.
Controllo di gestione: supportare il monitoraggio e la valutazione delle performance aziendali rispetto ai budget e ai forecast e la conseguente analisi degli scostamenti rispetto ai risultati attesi. Supportare il team nello sviluppo di query e nella definizione di procedure operative, nonch√© nella gestione e ottimizzazione della procedura di cost allocation.
Reportistica: supportare lo sviluppo e l‚Äôimplementazione di report e dashboard per comunicare i risultati delle analisi e facilitare la presa di decisioni da parte dei responsabili.
Data Modeling: creare modelli e strumenti di analisi predittiva per supportare la previsione delle tendenze e la valutazione degli impatti delle decisioni aziendali.
Collaborazione interfunzionale: essere in grado di interfacciarsi con le diverse strutture aziendali per comprenderne di supporto analitico e le esigenze informative del management.
Ottimizzazione dei processi: identificare opportunit√† per ottimizzare i processi aziendali attraverso l'analisi dei dati e la proposta di soluzioni migliorative.




üéì Requisiti:

Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Data Science, Economia/Finanza o campo correlato
Esperienza nell‚Äôanalisi ed interpretazione dei dati
Interesse e predisposizione all‚Äôapprofondimento di tematiche contabili e finanziarie
Buona conoscenza di Excel
Conoscenza avanzata di SQL. Nice to have conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione (e.g. Python)

Il candidato che stiamo cercando ha maturato almeno 2 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst in organizzazioni strutturate; avr√† una solida mentalit√† analitica, una profonda comprensione dei dati e la capacit√† di tradurre informazioni complesse e dati grezzi in insights utili per guidare le decisioni strategiche dell‚Äôazienda.

  • Pianificazione: collaborare con il team per sviluppare piani strategici e operativi basati sull'analisi dei dati, supportando le attivit√† di budgeting, forecasting e simulazioni.

Supportare il team nello sviluppo di query e nella definizione di procedure operative, nonch√© nella gestione e ottimizzazione della procedura di cost allocation.

Title: Analyst, Data Analysis
Description:
Job Description

Job Purpose

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.

Responsibilities


Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review


Knowledge And Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an economic field
Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

Title: Analyst, Data Analysis
Description:
Job Description

Job Purpose

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team at ICE. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex financial datasets, identifying trends, and overseeing the collection and maintenance of critical data assets.

This role demands analytical abilities, proficiency with leading data analysis tools, and strong communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

The Data Analyst will be tasked with Investments Funds and Warrants-Certificates reference data analysis, data management and standardization, sources research in order to set up wide financial reference datasets in proprietary systems.

Additionally, the candidate will be asked to establish and nurture relationships with Investments Funds and Warrant-Certificates issuers across Europe and, when required, in non-European regions. Among the duties there is the setup of issuing documents flows (KIDs, Factsheets, reporting and regulations Templates).

The candidate should proactively identify opportunities to optimize processes related to data entry and loading through the implementation of dedicated tools.

Furthermore, the role involves providing support to both Italian and international Clients by offering clear explanations and guidance regarding data standardization, content, frequency, and updates. The successful candidate will be instrumental in ensuring high data quality and supporting strategic business initiatives through actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver insights.
Perform data validation and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Utilize statistical methods to analyze financial data.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of data-driven strategies and initiatives.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and financial services.


Knowledge And Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Economics, Banking or Statistic and Data Science and related field.
Previous experience in data analysis, preferably in the financial sector would be an asset.
Experience with data modeling, statistical analysis is a plus.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis software.
Knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance in the financial industry is a plus
Fluent in Italian and English
Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze complex datasets and derive meaningful insights.
Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R (preferably knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI).
Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Team Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with various departments is a must.
Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing business needs and priorities.

Title: Junior Consultant Data Analyst (Intern)
Description:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.

La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:


Disegno di basi dati con finalit√† analitiche
Analisi e integrazione di fonti dati
Analisi, progettazione e implementazione di reporting e cruscotti di monitoraggio
Analisi dei processi di business e disegno di modelli analitici a supporto
Implementazione di soluzioni analitiche, supporto al go-live e application maintenance.


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:


Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica;
Hai sviluppato conoscenza in ambito dati e database (modelli dati entit√†/relazioni, DBMS)
Hai sviluppato interesse per l'ambito Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics;
Hai sviluppato la capacit√† di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati;
Hai maturato onoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero;
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL; la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†;
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra;
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale;
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati;
Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative;
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico.


Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†

At KPMG - no secrets with big data

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.

Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


Designing databases for analytical purposes
Analyzing and integrating data sources
Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling;
You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad;
You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL; knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.


Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.


Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.

Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.

Specifically, you will be tasked with:

  • Designing databases for analytical purposes
  • Analyzing and integrating data sources
  • Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
  • Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
  • Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.

Skills

 Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:

  • You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
  • You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
  • You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
  • You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling;
  • You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad;
  • You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL; knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG

  • An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
  • A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
  • Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
  • Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
  • International mindset and innovative projects.
  • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.

Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:


Consumer Engagement
Parts, Accessories & Service Performance
Actionable Insights
Diagnostics & Repair Enhancement
Warranty and Repair Efficiency
Technical Information
Learning Solutions
Sales Performance


Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.

The MSXI Purpose

To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world

The MSXI Mission

To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,

and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions

The MSXI Vision

To enhance every journey in the world of mobility

Job Description

Business Data Analyst

40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

Rome, hybrid

Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!

MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

The Role

Responsibilities

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:


Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences


Qualifications

About you

About

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:


3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
Fluent level of English


If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

What‚Äôs in it for you?

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.

In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy


Competitive salary
Company laptop and phone
Lunch voucher


Working Pattern


40 hours per week
Monday ‚Äì Friday
Rome - hybrid


You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Junior Data Science - SAS
HTML:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.

La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:

  • Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven;
  • Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali;
  • Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend.
  • Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo;

Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:

  • Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Statistica o altra ritenuta attinente;
  • Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python e SAS;
  • Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud;
  • Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati;
  • Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly;
  • Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS);
  • Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero;

Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG

  • Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
  • Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
  • Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
  • Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
  • Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
  • Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico

Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.

Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.

Specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies;
  • Modeling: developing new Machine Learning models ad hoc to meet business demands and requirements;
  • Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications.
  • Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it;

Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.

This opportunity is perfect for you if:

  • You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics or other deemed relevant;
  • You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python and SAS;
  • You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure;
  • You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation;
  • You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly;
  • You have basic skills with major cloud platforms (Azure, AWS);
  • You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad;

Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.

  • An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
  • A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
  • Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
  • Advanced training and development programs to stay current
  • International mindset and innovative projects
  • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being

Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

Title: AML Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

AML Data Analyst Intern

AML Data Analyst Intern

Rome, Italy

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

Join a dynamic team dedicated to support the growth in full compliance with Worldline‚Äôs merchant risk policies safeguarding our financial forefront, where every day offers the chance to make an impact in the fight against money laundering and terrorism financing. We are seeking a AML Data Analyst Intern to join our team, reporting to the Head of First Line of Defense Risk and Compliance at Worldline Merchant Services Italia. Your role will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decision-making, to streamline operations and ensure compliance with the company's standards.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities


Reporting KYC: Gather data needed for AML KYC purposes from different business sources and prepare monthly reports detailing KYC information, ensuring weekly updates to reflect current review status in monthly committees;
Reporting Internal Committee: Compile data related to KYC, Credit, and Fraud activities into an annual report file including statistics and updates from involved departments (Compliance, Operations, AML) on periodic basis;
Reporting Business Information KPIs: Analyze Business Information KPIs in onboarding and ongoing merchant activities; Identify consumption trends or changes, highlighting concerns or improvement opportunities in relation to contractual consumption caps;
Preparation of Functional Analysis Files for IT Implementations: Support internal Project Managers in the collaboration with Compliance, Operations, Information Technology to collect and document business requirements for different IT Implementation.


Who Are We Looking For

We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what‚Äôs next ‚Äì people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:


Master's degree in Economics, Management, or Law;
Familiarity with data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R);
Strong critical thinking, analytical, and organizational skills;
Excellent communication skills;
Basic knowledge of KYC and AML processes as a plus;
Good level of English in speaking and writing.


Perks & Benefits

At Worldline you‚Äôll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:


Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
Enjoy remote work (50%).
Enjoy wide range of training through our eLearning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Percipio, Speex, Cross Knowledge).


Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you‚Äôll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.
Show more

  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Basic knowledge of KYC and AML processes as a plus;
  • Good level of English in speaking and writing.

Perks & Benefits

At Worldline you‚Äôll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

  • Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
  • Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
  • Enjoy remote work (50%).
  • Enjoy wide range of training through our eLearning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Percipio, Speex, Cross Knowledge).

Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you‚Äôll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: HR Data Analyst
HTML:
Per azienda strutturata e modernamente organizzata in fase di fermento organizzativo trainato da un business in grandissima espansione e sviluppo, siamo alla ricerca di un HR Data Analyst

Responsibilities

La figura si occuper√† delle seguenti attivit√†:

  • Raccolta, monitoraggio e verifica della qualit√† dei dati della funzione HR;
  • Creazione di report e dashboard per il monitoraggio delle performance;
  • Collaborare con le business line per integrare soluzioni analitiche nei processi aziendali.

Your Profile

Verranno prese in considerazione figure in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:

  • Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Informatica, Economia o discipline affini
  • Ottima conoscenza di Excel;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • Esperienza con software di visualizzazione dati (es. Tableau, Power BI);
  • Capacit√† di problem solving e attitudine analitica.

Title: Power BI Data Analyst (Rif. 2025-151)
Description:
aizoOn, societ√† di consulenza tecnologica di innovazione, indipendente, che opera a livello globale ricerca un / a Power BI Data Analyst.




All‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôarea ICT della Divisione Transportation di aizoOn, si ricerca un/una professionista con competenze consolidate in Power BI, analisi dati e data engineering, da inserire su un progetto strategico presso un cliente multinazionale leader nel settore ferroviario.




Attivit√† previste




Il/la candidato/a selezionato/a sar√† coinvolto/a in un‚Äôiniziativa di ingegnerizzazione di una soluzione Power BI, con responsabilit√† dirette nella:




Progettazione e realizzazione di dashboard interattive e scalabili, in grado di rappresentare informazioni complesse in modo chiaro e funzionale
Analisi e gestione di grandi volumi di dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di estrarre insight utili al supporto decisionale
Definizione e implementazione di processi ETL robusti e ottimizzati
Produzione di report personalizzati e KPI a supporto delle diverse funzioni aziendali




PROFILO




Laurea in discipline tecnico-scientifiche (es. Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica)
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 2-3 anni in ambito data analysis o business intelligence
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, scritta e parlata




COMPETENZE TECNICHE




Ottima padronanza di Microsoft Power BI, sia lato modellazione dati sia visualizzazione
Competenze in DAX per la creazione di misure, colonne calcolate e logiche avanzate




INFORMAZIONI AGGIUNTIVE




Possibilit√† di lavorare in modalit√† Ibrida presso cliente a Roma.




The job search refers to candidates of both genders

Title: Business Intelligence & Data Analytics (Stage)
Description:
Chi siamo?

Blastness S.P.A. fornisce sistemi, servizi e formazione a strutture ricettive indipendenti ed √® specializzata nella creazione di siti web per il settore alberghiero e nelle attivit√† di Digital Marketing.

√à da oltre 10 anni leader nella fornitura ad Hotel di lusso di sistemi di Booking Engine, Channel management, Rate Checker e distribuzione GDS. Ha sviluppato sistemi proprietari di Business Intelligence e Revenue Management System, integrando funzionalit√† ed algoritmi di Artificial Intelligence e Machine Learning anche nelle attivit√† di Search Engine Advertising.




Chi cerchiamo?

Cerchiamo una figura con la passione per la tecnologia e l'informatica, con una costante voglia di mettersi in gioco in nuove sfide, pronta a unirsi nel nostro Team Soft Coding dove trover√† un ambiente giovane, dinamico e all'avanguardia nel settore della reportistica e analisi dati in ambito turistico.




Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?

Laurea o Diploma in ambito elettronica/programmazione/informatico (l‚Äôapprofondimento in ambito turistico √® un plus)
Conoscenza della lingua Italiana
Conoscenza base e logica di uno o pi√π linguaggi di programmazione
Conoscenza e passione per il mondo Hardware e Software
Ottima conoscenza e padronanza del pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel Avanzato
Precisione ed accuratezza nello svolgimento delle mansioni
Propensione al lavoro in Team
Raggiungimento degli obiettivi prefissati




Di cosa ti occuperai?

Supporto alla creazione e manutenzione di report Excel
Gestione Mail
Analisi e lavorazione dati tramite PowerQuery
Sviluppo processi automatizzati con PowerAutomate
Affiancamento con altri membri del Team su progetti pi√π complessi




Sede ed orari di lavoro:

Presso i nostri uffici di Roma (zona EUR)

Lun/Ven - 09:00/13:00, 14:00/18:00




Contratto di lavoro: Tirocinio formativo/stage

Durata contratto: 6 mesi

Stipendio: ‚Ç¨800,00 al mese




Benefit: Computer e telefono aziendale

Orario: Dal luned√¨ al venerd√¨




Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le et√† e tutte le nazionalit√†, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03

Title: Junior Data Engineer_Roma
Description:
Siamo una Data Driven Transformation & Consulting Company specializzata nel gestire e trasformare il pi√π importante asset del mercato odierno: I Dati.

Grazie ad oltre 20 anni di esperienza e 500 dipendenti divisi in 4 sedi (Bologna HQ, Milano, Roma e Napoli) supportiamo l‚Äôevoluzione di grandi gruppi italiani operanti in tutti i principali settori, dal bancario al manifatturiero, passando per il Fashion, il Retail, l‚ÄôEnergy e le Telco senza dimenticare le grandi pubbliche amministrazioni centrali.

Il nostro portfolio progetti spazia da servizi di Advisory quali la realizzazione di Data Strategy fino ad attivit√† di implementazione con il design e la realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Analytics, Big Data Platform & Artificial Intelligence.

Siamo un‚Äôazienda dinamica, con un Dna che si √® plasmato in questi anni grazie al fatto di aver coltivato oltre l‚Äô80% delle nostre risorse dall‚Äôuniversit√†, e in continua trasformazione cos√¨ come il mercato in cui operiamo e del quale siamo fra i player pi√π riconosciuti e grandi del panorama italiano

Posizione:

Iconsulting √® alla ricerca di talentuosi neolaureati da inserire nei team di progetto con il ruolo di Data Engineer.

Entrando a far parte della nostra squadra, avrai l'opportunit√† di lavorare a stretto contatto con un team di esperti su progetti innovativi e tecnicamente avanzati nell'ambito dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di aiutare i clienti a sviluppare le loro strategie IT.

Al tuo ingresso in Azienda riceverai una formazione strutturata e sarai supportato da un tutor dedicato che ti guider√† nell'apprendimento delle principali tecnologie di mercato e ti aiuter√† a sviluppare le competenze necessarie.

Requisiti:


Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica o Informatica
Esperienza pratica con database relazionali e competenza nell'utilizzo di SQL
Una buona conoscenza dei linguaggi Python e Java
Conoscenza preferenziale in ambito Data integration e Database (Relazionali es. MySql);
Interesse per le tecnologie NoSQL e Big Data
Preferibile familiarit√† con strumenti di Data Visualization come Tableau, Power BI o Qlik
Padronanza del pacchetto Office.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Un'attitudine all'analisi logico-matematica
Curiosit√†, voglia di imparare, proattivit√† e interesse per i principali trend tecnologici del momento


Altre informazioni:

Cosa offriamo ai candidati?

Ai candidati selezionati verr√† offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

Sede di lavoro: Roma o Napoli. E' previsto lo smart working.

Title: Data specialist/Statistician ‚Äì based in Luxembourg
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General (SG) ‚Äì Economic Department (ECON) ‚Äì Economic Studies Division (ES) ‚Äì Statistical Unit (SU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a Data specialist/Statistician*.

This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


Internal benchmark Associate Economist


Panel interviews are foreseen as from the end of August 2025 .

Purpose

You will maintain economic databases, statistics, as well as contribute to economic and econometric analysis to derive recommendations that help shape strategic decision-making of the EIB in order to contribute to policy formulation and dialogue.

Operating Network

The unit is positioned in SG/ECON/ES but serves the needs of the whole department. The unit designs, develops and maintains all databases, manages the contractual agreements with private database providers, offers statistical and econometric support to ECON staff, maintains the ECON server and various data toolkits posted on the EIB website and organises the sharing of data through secured and restricted web access with external collaborators.

In addition, the unit contributes to automatize processes related to country, policy and research work, provides technical support related to the ratings of sovereigns and banks as well as to local currency pricing. Relatedly, it manages control functions and critical report declarations such as EUC and ICF. You will report to the Head of the Statistical Unit, under the overall supervision of the Head of the Economic Studies Division and the Director of the Department.

Accountabilities


Maintain the Department‚Äôs data-architecture, including databases, tools and interfaces.
Support and contribute to statistical, econometric and economic analyses.
Support the technical implementation of tools for surveys and data analytics based on surveys.
Communicate analytical results visually and contribute to standardizing reporting and presentation outputs in a way that can be understood by non-experts.
Contribute to the development of tools to standardize the presentation of economic output of the department.
Collaborate with the assigned IT team on the solutions of the process simplification and automation.
Liaise with relevant counterparts within the Department, the Bank as well as in other national, EU, and international institutions and think tanks.
Contribute through database development and relevant analysis to the policy dialogue and the analysis of key models and policy papers and presentations as well as for other internal and external stakeholders.
Propose improvements of processes, procedures, methodologies and working methods.


Qualifications


University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in econometrics, quantitative economics, mathematics, statistics, information technology;
At least 3 years of experience in statistical analyses, database management and econometrics, for example acquired working in the relevant units of an international or EU institution, statistical office, consulting, government, banking, academia;
Programming skills (Python, R, SQL, VBA, MiKTeX, JavaScript) and knowledge of relevant software for data management and analysis (Stata, RStudio, SAS);
Knowledge of applied quantitative methods;
Knowledge of economic concepts and standard relevant macroeconomic and microeconomic data series and sources
Previous experience in integrating big data in economic analysis and/or knowledge of survey statistical methods would be an advantage;
Experience in written, visual and oral communication of complex quantitative analyses;
Ability to deliver under time pressure when needed;
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French and a good knowledge of the other (**). Working knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(**) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

This is an open campaign to consecutively fill an open position. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.
